Reviews.Title: “Very clean,friendly and convenient for all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: Antilees6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Rex.When chosing this hotel I was guided by the favourable reports on Tripadvisor. I booked a standard double room but upon our arrival was very disappointed when we were shown our room which was almost like a shoe box containing a double bed, a wardrobe,no dressing table and a tiny shower room. I am quite a petite person and even so had trouble negotiating the entrance to the bathroom as the only way in meant squeezing in between the door and the sink! Although very clean, the room looked 'tired' and in need of some re-decoration. There was also an adjoining door which led to another room whose occupants were a family with a baby who you could hear talking quite clearly, so obviously it didn't feel very private. Maybe we should have made our concerns known immediately but we decided to give it a try as we weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room but after one night decided this was unacceptable. The hotel is classed as a four star but this room was definitely not four star accomodation. We expressed our concerns to the man on the desk the following morning, who said that we could change rooms and that the new room would be available later that day and there didn't seem to be a problem with this. The second room was much bigger and more comfortable and appeared to be something more like a four star and although very clean, still looked a bit shabby and the wallpaper was hanging off in one corner near the window. I'm not sure what the second room would be classed as and would be interested to see what a superior room was like.There was no extra charge for changing rooms.Breakfast was quite adequate with a selection of breads, pastries, fruit and juices. There also seemed to be other people who were not satisfied with their rooms as on two occasions we overheard people asking to be moved.The staff were friendly and helpful and we would return as the hotel is in an excellent location and as first time travellers to Rome we found it to be very convenient and would recommend it - a bit more attention to detail in the room decor would make a big difference.Hope other people will find this helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Rome and stayed at the Hotel Rex, deciding on it based on it's good reviews. It did not disappoint! We had contacted the hotel via email about a week before our arrival to ask a few questions, confirm our reservation and make sure a crib was available for our 9 month old. They promptly replied and were very helpful in answering our questions. Upon arrival, the pack 'n' play was set up in our room and was was made- with a sheet, blanket and little pillow. So very nice since usually hotels deliver a pack 'n' play at the door, requiring you to set it up and most do not offer sheets/blankets/pillows to go with it. The room was a good size, a little tight, but that's European for you. It was a little dated, but clean and that's all that matters. We did get a little hot during the night- I'm not sure if the a/c didn't work or what, but we were so exhausted we slept well no matter what. The breakfast was AWESOME! A wonderful variety of hot dishes (egg soufle type dish, another hot dish I can't think of the name), meats, cheeses, yogurts, breads, cereals, pastries galore, fruit, OJ, cappuccino, latte, espresso, coffee Americano- a great way to fill up before you venture out into the city! And the kitchen staff were so friendly! The location is superb! We took the Leo Express from the airport, arrived at the Termini and was at our hotel within 5 minutes. We got there at about 1030 at night and felt safe (we walked from the Termini with our luggage and 9 month old son in a stroller). We walked to all of the locations in the city- the Colosseo/Forum/Palatine Hill, Vittorio Emmanule II monument, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and numerous museums, piazzas and restaurants. We took the metro (from Termini) to the Vatican and the Aqueducts- 1 Euro each way and the bus to the Galleria Borghese- again, 1 Euro each way. Seriously easy to get to everything you need to from this hotel. The restaurant Strega is close by and we loved it so much we went twice (wood fired pizza!). If you want to help make your Rome vacation a good one, stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Laleh B
Reviews.Content: The hotel located close to the Termini train station.The staff was very nice and friendly.The room was clean and comfortable .the breakfast was ok but could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: phlipManchester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Rex bet Wed 28th - 31st March 2012 during a 3 day break to Rome. We stayed in a superior room. The Hotel is very covenient to Termini station being only a 5 minute walk, and is opposite the Opera Theatre. Recepetion staff were very efficient, helpful and informative. Our superior room was very comfortable but a bit dated. The bed was huge and comfy. However, beware.. The room has a 'kettle pack' containing a few sachets of tea, coffee & a couple of milks. These have to last you the length of your stay or cost 1.50 Eu to get another. Bit of a rip off even with Italy's austerity measures and in all honesty, a bit tacky. The hotel has plenty of maps etc to assist in your explorations. Rome has gone a bit expensive..8 eu for a medium beer. But the eternal city is still fantastic. The Hard Rock in Rome is always good for a meal and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dreyes1047
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful gem just three blocks from Termini, Republicca, and Sta Maria Maggiore, stucked in the quiet part of the busy area. The staff is very personable and efficient, the rooms have wonderful amenities, and are very comfortable, breakfast is very nice. It is definitely one of the best options amongst all of the hotels by the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: elaine b
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 kids. Stayed at Hotel Rex for 5 days and are very pleased. The service is excellent. The receptionists always try to help with any query. The room was very clean. The breakfast is quite good too. A selection of croissants and really yummy. A good way to start the day in Rome. Thanks to all the staff at Rex. You made our stay a memorable one. Arrivederci Roma!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but night staff unhelpful and room small and dark”
Reviews.Author: Joy W
Reviews.Content: My 18 yr old son and I booked a twin room and we were shown to 601 which was lovely - and would have been lovelier had we been able to open the window and shutters. However, despite advertising wi-fi in ALL rooms 2 iPads and 2 smart phones could not access the Internet past the first floor. The receptionist who greeted us upon our arrival was so friendly that I was surprised by the disinterested attitude of the gentleman on duty later when I reported the problem. There is a limit to how much time an 18yr old wants to spend with his Mum and whilst the Internet access in the library area was fine we wanted some time apart - leaving me offline in the room. After having to request a room move (it was not offered) we were transferred the following day - to a smaller, hotter and darker room looking out over the lift shaft. This seemed a little mean as the problem was not of our making. Also the patio area was closed due to renovations which meant standing in the street to smoke. Breakfast was good - be sure to request Capuchino from the kitchen. The location is good and the day staff printed off Vatican City tickets, sold us metro tickets and were helpful with directions and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rex takes customer service to a new level!”
Reviews.Author: dcappy
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel Rex are absolutely fantastic, and they really make the stay. Usually I care less about the staff at a hotel and more about the room but in this case it's the reverse. The staff knew we were Canadians from our passport, and printed us off the front page of a major canadian news paper in the morning, what an amazing touch. The breakfast and cappuccinos were fantastic, with pastries, fruit, salad, frittatas, meat and cereal we were more than full. Location of the hotel is very good. The rooms are very clean, and are perfectly fine, but they are quite small. I would recommend this hotel for families and friends that are traveling, though couples looking for a romantic getaway may be slightly underwhelmed by the rooms if they are looking for something fancy. That said you can't expect the ritz on a budget, and hotel Rex provides great rooms and service for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But on a Narrow Street”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: 03/20/12 We just came back from a week trip to Rome and stayed at the Rex. you will find Great service here for a small hotel. Franchesca was great help and always very pleasant to talk too, her English was very good. WiFi worked great, also they have a computer you can use with a printer that was free to use. Our room was 203 a little narrow but had a king bed and a twin for the three of us. The bathroom was a good size. Room was clean... no view from window. Breakfast was good a little different than in US but you left full and never got sick. Metro and termini a 10 minute walk. Some tips.... From airport Fromunico you can take Terrivision Bus 4 euros non stop to termini. Take a debit card to get euros at an ATM much cheaper than exchange places down there banks will not exchange US money there.... also buy some euros here at your bank. The Metro is cheap to use 1 euro 1 way or get an all day pass at front desk 4 euros. At restuarants ask for tap water, bread is not free, everything is extra... so just order what you want with no extras... say no if they put something on your table you do not want. You can bargain with some vendors.... example the ones on the street selling pocket books. If they want 40 euros offer them 10 to 15..... remember our exchange rate is not good there. Water is fine to drink there fountains etc..... The Metro is packed at some stops keep your wallet in front pocket or do not carry a pocket book. Most dress in jeans a black leather jacket and a scarp or gray top. Most younger women do not dye their and keep it long. Anyway everyone seems to dress the same.... take good walking shoes.... sneakers. Most streets are coble stone. Overall a great experience ..... you can walk to a lot of attractions our week the temperature was in low 60's. My email address if you want more tips. grease00us@yahoo.com Also you don't have to tip at restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: spryfieldCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked for price and location [5 min fr train station] and were happy with the breakfast,the large clean room,friendly staff. Near many restaurants and could walk to many attractions. Staff is very helpful in pointing out where to eat and what to see.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tantan220
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Rex in Rome and had a great experience! We got a very affordable rate by booking directly on the hotel's website. The font desk staff was very friendly and helpful during the check in process. They made sure we were familiar with the area and provided us directions to all major attractions. As others have said, the hotel is in a great location near the Termini train station and it's easy to walk to all major sights. The room was a little bit on the smaller side, but was perfectly functional since we really just needed a place to sleep! Our shower had a rain showerhead which was nice. The included breakfast each morning was delicious. They even made us each a cappuccino each morning! My birthday was on the 27th and the staff made an effort to wish me a happy birthday and gave me a card. I highly recommend the Hotel Rex for your trip to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky-good!”
Reviews.Author: HoneymooninPeru
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not huge. That's it for the negatives. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is ample and tasty. The rooms are clean and have wifi and nice televisions. There's a workout room in the basement. And the location is perfect -- steps from all the metro stops! We felt very lucky to have wound up here.

Reviews.Title: “Great and interesting hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: TiffTiph
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here over the weekend. She arrived on Thursday night on her own and I joined for Friday and Saturday. I think there was a misunderstanding that we wanted a twin room but they gave her a Queen room for the first night and moved us to a massive room that had 2 beds, for the rest of the stay. This room was massive! It had an old imac in it (these were dotted randomly all around the hotel actually, it was a bit bizarre but funny). Also had a tv with foxtel, a playstation where you could watch dvds that were available downstairs as well as games. They had lots of nice extras like a tea set with lots of different teas, biscuits by the bed, minibar and shampoo and conditioner/soap in the bathroom. And also free wifi in the room. The bathroom was also huge! The only problem was the lack of shower curtain in there, water went everywhere!!! But the shower was great. Breakfast was also included and was served downstairs under the hotel almost. I could only have it the first day as I didn't get time on the second. There seemed like a lot of pastries and cereals and a bit of salad stuff including an omelette. Plus juice and the lovely waiter makes coffees. There is a small bar area next to the lobby that had a coffee machine and nice staff, and there is a room next to that with the dvds, games and also boardgames. Lots of stuff for kids. All of the staff are lovely, friendly and very helpful. I usually stay at another b&b everytime I come to Rome, but this trip was quite last minute so we stayed here and I was pleasantly surprised and impressed. And I thought the hotel was in a great location. I'd recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yaya32
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Rex. We loved the proximity to the Termini station and all the restaurants that were nearby. We would recommend that travelers be realistic when traveling to Rome as most hotels have smaller rooms than those in the US. The staff was very helpful particularly Francesca who patiently answered all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “A good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicfal
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for a quick 4 day holiday between the 5th and 8th January. We booked the Rex Hotel through the internet. It proved a good choice. The room was very spacious by city hotel standards, the location couldn't have been better, within a short distance of Via Nazionale, Terminin station and all the sites within walking distance. The Metro is just 5 minutes away. The service was good, with Francesca behind the reception counter being exceptionally welcoming. Breakfast was very reasonable for the price. The only negative was that the rooms are not 100% soundproof and at times guests could be heard moving about the rooms at odd hours, probably moving in or out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MissionAdventure
Reviews.Content: About our stay: We've stayed there for a 5 days in December, the first room we got the first day was not your average 4 stars room, but when we asked for a room change the staff was very courteous and did that immediately. The second room we got was spacious, clean, with a Tv and fridge, a very comfortable bed, and we found very useful the tea kettle, and in the bathroom we had a bathtub too. Location: It is very near the main train station Termini and on the same street there are 2 ATM's and a traveling agency, and not very far there are different nice little restaurants, some opened until late too. You can walk to sightsee, or you can easily take the metro or buses that cover the whole city(we bought a Roma Pass Card). Staff: they gave us very useful information about the city, with a city map too, feel free to ask informations about places you want to visit, they have different brochures there at the reception too, and they are always friendly and polite, Francesca was really helpful and kind. Breakfast: very friendly staff there too, and there's a buffet with a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars - Thank You”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen D
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Rome, stayed 3 nights, the entire staff was helpful, courteous and friendly - location was great, we were able to walk everywhere to sightsee. Breakfast was included with our stay and met our needs to start off our day. Highly recommend and will definitely book future stays at the Hotel Rex.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars for a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gateway_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for three nights in Dec 2011. The hotel is located five minutes away from Termini statriona nd is easy to get to. Firstly the positives. The satff were were very good. The young lady at the reception helped us to organise footbal tickets for the Lazio game we had come to see. She told us which buses to get and where to go etc, she even printed off the stadium map. The room and bathroom were very good. Breakfast was adequate. The staff really are very good. And now the negatives. The tea/coffee in the room isnt free. I think they should either remove it from the room or make it free. We had requested a twin room. We did get twio single beds, but they were pushed together and the bedding was laid out as if it was a double, this was rectified after the first night. The really annoying thing wasnt actually to do with the hotel itself. The building next door was having some work done and hearing very loud drillling at 8am wasnt appreciated. One the whole the negatives are not so bad. Location is very good. Satff speak good English. Would I stay here again - yes...(but would like free tea next time).

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rex 5 - 9 Dec 11. Upon arrival we were met by Francesca who was very helpful and provided us with a map a lots of information on the city. Our room was large with a Queen bed, double wardrobe and seperate bathroom. Furniture and decor of the room was lovely. They do charge for the use of the tea & coffee, however, we read about this beforehand and took our own. You can easily pick up milk at the shop and keep it fresh in the mini bar fridge provided in the room.The breakfast was great with lots to choose from. The hotel was in a good location with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. As mentioned, the hotel is a 5 minute walk from Termini Station. We used the underground to get around. An all day ticket can be purchased from the Hotel for 4 euros. Overall, I would say Rex was good value for what we paid, in a good location with helpfull and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: JayS88
Reviews.Content: Great location if you need to be near Termini. Room was clean. OK beds OK breakfast. Unfortunally I got there after a big downfall (rain) and they lost their boiler so no hot water for the entire stay. It was fixed just as I left for the train! Like daboy1, found the female staff friendly - the male staff was aloof.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Rex!”
Reviews.Author: Travelin10ACgurl
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hotel Rex Nov 18-Nov 23 and it was great. Very comfortable beds, delicious breakfast buffet, super staff (male and female) and every helpful to us when we needed directions or suggestions. Our room (Room 103) was huge! The living room had a queen bed and the bedroom had a king bed (there were 3 people in our room). The bathroom was large as well with very large fluffy towels. We loved that the hotel was a short 3-4 block walk to Termini. We ate at two restaurants right up the street that were fabulous. When I go back to Rome, I'll definitely stay there. Love the Rex!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BenGait
Reviews.Content: Many of the other reviewers here have already argued the case for Hotel Rex. Suffice for me to say that the hotel is brilliant. Not only did I secure a room at a bargain price but I was also upgraded free of charge upon arrival. The staff are exceptional and always go above and beyond the expected standard to ensure that everything is in place for a highly enjoyable stay in Rome. Great location. Great breakfast. The Hotel Rex has a lot of character and will be my first port of call the next time I visit Rome. Thanks again to the fabulous staff for the brilliant service!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and tour Rome”
Reviews.Author: Brad W
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Rex to be conveniently located near public transportation including the Main Train Station. The rooms were clean and well cared for and breakfast was included in a very reasonable room price. The hotel staff speak English well and are very accommodating and helpful. Several Trattorias and Ristorantes are within a block or two of the hotel. We would definitely select Hotel Rex on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The staff couldn't be any more helpful”
Reviews.Author: DominicW
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner just returned from a short trip to Rome and stayed in the Hotel Rex from 17th November to 20th November. The staff were all brilliant from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Reception were always extremely polite, friendly and very helpful - with perfect English too. It would be easy to find fault in anything if you wanted to, like the bathroom looking in need of a little makeover but it couldn't affect the overall feeling that you could have a good sleep in an extremely comfortable bed, have a decent hot shower to get you awake in the morning and receive an ample continental breakfast with the assistance of more very helpful, friendly staff (give them a break if the coffee machine breaks down it is not their fault and the staff were more than happy to supply everyone with coffee from the kitchen - some people act like it's the end of the world!). The location of the Hotel was good too, close to the Termini and within easy walking distance of all central tourist attractions, in fact the only time we used public transpiort was when we were short of time and got the 1 Euro ticket to Cipro to visit the Vatican City Museum saving us about 30 minutes. We even saw one of the Reception staff walking down the adjacent elevator on their way to the Metro and to reinforce how friendly the Hotel Rex staff were he stopped and had a conversation with us even though he'd worked through the night and was probably very tired and looking forward to his rest. Thanks for your hospitality - Dominic and Jane

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bagpiper51
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the hotel rex the weekend before a 10 day cruise and the weekend after. this was our first time to italy and we picked hotel rex after spending countless hours on the internet searching for a hotel that met our needs. we really lucked out (thanks to everyone on trip advisor reviews). after our first 3 day stint at the end of october the girl at checkout asked if we would like the same room upon our return. we said yes. when we returned we were upgraded to a 2 room suite at the same cost as the room we were supposed to have. we really didn't need the additional room but it was certainly better than being in a single room. for the most part the staff was very helpful, with most of the help speaking passable english. if i were to return to rome, i would not even waste my time in searching for another hotel, hotel rex would be my one and only choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronald D
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Rome with my wife and daughter. We stayed at the Hotel Rex and I can honestly say I have seldom stayed in such a perfect and pleasant city hotel. The hotel is in a very central location so that all the highlights of Rome are within walking distance.The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the breakfast is an excellent start to the day.However the hotel's best asset is the extremely friendly,helpful and courteous staff. They gave us excellent advice on how to make the best of our stay in Rome and assisted in every way they possibly could. I would again like to thank the staff for making our first visit to Rome such a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “"The Rex"”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer1855
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rex in September 2011. The staff was absolutely wonderful! It is a charming hotel in the center of Rome with very easy access to many attractions. The breakfast was terrific and our 8 year old son loved the DVD movies they have on hand. The hotel is undergoing renovations but staff went out of their way to accomodate the guests. If we return to Rome we will definitely stay at "The REX"! C.G. and family from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvarnell
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find walking from the Termini station, 10 mins tops., The room was as described and quite a big bathroom. Very helpful and pleasant staff throughout the hotel. English was spoken in the whole hotel and a new restaurant had just been added to the hotel. A very central base, walking distance to all the main attractions. Plenty of choice in restaurants and eating houses close by. We used the red 102 open top bus, 18 euros for 48 hours hop on and off, this helped you get around the city. Gallo Motto also known as the chicken house on Cavour street was fab, true Italian atmosphere and traditional food, get there early as it is very popular with the locals as well. A great stay, would stay there again, one more tip, watch Roman Holiday before you visit. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the hotels we stayed at in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Banpei
Reviews.Content: On a trip through Rome, Paris, and London, we stayed at three hotels, but Hotel Rex was easily our favorite. Looking at it initially through Google Street view and just walking up to it, I did have my initial misgivings. The front was very....spartan and unassuming. However, as soon as we got inside all of that was dismissed. The room was spotless, the staff was very polite and helpful, and the included breakfast was 100x better than I thought it would be. When we come back to Rome, this is definitely where we'll be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AprilnPat
Reviews.Content: During a 2 week bound through Europe (including Paris, Versailles, Swiss Alps, Venice, Florence and Rome), my husband and I stayed in our fair share of hotels. Unfortunately, we found out the hard way that the best way to truely enjoy a European vacation is to get a good night's rest. I few of the places that we stayed did not provide this and it made our trip (while still wonderful) I little harder than it should have been. (ear plugs while you sleep to block out traffic and sidewalk noise does not equal a good night's sleep). Our final stop was Rome. Luckily, we thought ahead on this leg of our journey and booked the Hotel Rex via www.priceline.com. We actually happened upon it by chance as we used the "name your own price" feature on Priceline. This feature only allows you to select the star rating and general location of your hotel but not your actual hotel. Hotel Rex took our bid and we are so happy that they did. After many sleepless nights in a row the Hotel Rex provided several much needed nights of rest. The facility was very clean, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were QUIET!. No outside noise.... no noise from ajoining rooms. Just sweet quiet. :-) Another huge advantage to the Hotel Rex was that it was just a couple of blocks from Rome's main train station. This provided us quick and easy access to all international trains, the local metro and also the Rome bus system. There were also many shops and restaurants within a very short walk. Overall, Rome was a wonderful experience and much of that is due to the fact that we chose to stay at the Hotel Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Very child-friendly, and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WorseHalf
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our welcome at the Hotel Rex! We arrived quite tired after a long train ride, and the staff was warm and friendly. The reception had iced coffee and tea and little cookies, and they gave stuffed animals to our two small boys. The room was comfortable, with modern features and nice little touches, and there was even a play area downstairs for the children!

Reviews.Title: “Re Visit”
Reviews.Author: Babaroonie
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at this hotel ( 3 yrs ago being the 1st) I would agree with everyones comments that the air con is not good, it was 33 deg on this visit and the room was very hot, but personally I hate air con so it was'nt an issue for me. The staff here were just a friendly as last time, and work very hard to please you, I have read one review here that the staff are rude, I can't imagine that as they only seem to want to please, and I am talking about at least 5 members of staff the bellboy included. I do not think that this hotel warrants a 4* rating though, if you use the coffee supplied with the kettle in the room, you are charged, I've never experienced that before ( it was'nt expensive though) the showers have really seen better days and need replacing, I would rate it as a 3* hotel. Like most cities close to the main station, the area had quite a few homeless people sleeping on the street around the hotel, not that you feel threatened by them, but its not very pleasant. Overall, the hotel is quite central, friendly, offers a good breakfast and the staff aim to please.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel , but”
Reviews.Author: F-Sylvain T
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many plus : 1 staff : highly professional . All service will be given to you for 99,9% of your demands . 2- They will keep your luggage if you book one week later ( after your first stay ).. This is unique 3- The rooms , are ok : if the weather is not over 30 , and not on Torino street when the sun hit them during the afternoon . here come the " BUT " the air conditioning is too old , and absolutely no efficacity. Samething in the the restaurant to get your breakfast . regarding the overall aspect of this hotel , it is very well situated , the staff will provide you all you need as computer , iPad , transport to the airport , etc . If you have the chance for an upgrade , pay for it , or ask for room in the garden ... number 601-2-3,,, on the third floor ..... I have stay 6 days the first week and 0one day the 2 following weeks .... It is obviously a 3 star hotel , and not a 4 star , , the cost is the average for the city , but the same room the last week was 32 euros more , we were lucky , they offer us a suite .... is was a cost value ééé

Reviews.Title: “No A/C and very hot, humid room in August.”
Reviews.Author: 685millie
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel online. It is in a central location, close to Termini. The front desk staff was very kind, but we left after the first night because the A/C didn't work and the room was too hot and humid. It was miserable. The front desk staff said that A/C in Italy is just different than in US. Yeah, right. We moved around the block to Starhotels Metropole where the A/C worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilly_424
Reviews.Content: I can not express how brilliant this hotel was. We stayed for 4 nights (17th-21st August 2011) - Upon arrival the man at reception was extreamly helpful, giving us maps with advice on how to get to the main attractions, restaurant options, and hotel information. The hotel was close enough to all the attractions-10 mins walk from the Colosseum/ Roman Forum, 5 mins from the Termini station, 10 mins from the Pantheon, 15 mins from the Vatican (allow longer times when walking the in heat!!). The room was very spacious and had the largest bed I had ever seen(the double could have fit four people in!) with lovely crisp white sheet. Bathroom was large too. Hot drink facilities available in the room as well and a cafe downstairs in the hotel. Sky TV/air-con/hairdryer/free safe all in room. There was a lovely room on the first floor which had a TV in and lots of books and a range of DVDs which could be watched. The Apple Mac was in the corner and internet both here and on WI-FI was FREE! Great! Breakfast was plentiful and the waitresses came to ask if anything else was needed, i.e cappuccino/hot chocolates which were made freshly in the kitchen. Staff attentive through-out the stay. I would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: R55wilson
Reviews.Content: Entry stairs to desk so if your luggage is heavy? Hot water was iffy. Three adults traveling and we were upgraded to larger room plenty of space. Airconditioning was marginal just glad it was not to hot. Very close to Train terminal and Metro but long walk to Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps. Laundromat close by. The Hotel was on a side street so traffic noise was minimal. Internet was slow and dropped service accasionaly. Breakfast was good. Overall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to the bus station, great service, clean, with high ceilings.”
Reviews.Author: gioia26
Reviews.Content: I brought a student group to this hotel. The service was phenomenal, they helped our group with all sorts of requests. Their one hotel elevator was being fixed, so only one was available. So it took some time to get up and down with the luggage. The rooms were clean and attractive, with a cultural charm and good electronics. The ceilings were high and the windows were grand. The bathrooms were marble and tile, very nice. The soaking tub was great. We walked from the train station, it took about 10 minutes at a slow pace. It is located near churches, museums and restaurants. Very nice area. The hotel made great dinner reservations for us. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sojouner2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex was a convenient location for our 3 days in Rome. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable. The rate included an excellent breakfast geared to travelers from all over the world. The staff was extremely helpful about giving directions to different sites and how to take the public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: thedaveymac
Reviews.Content: it was hot and muggy when we stayed here. we were only in town for one night and wanted to be close to termini station - which it was. the location seems to be in a dirtier part of Rome. the air conditioner was on all night, but we had to sleep on top of the sheets because it was still very warm and humid in our room - our parents room was the same. we had to let the water run in the shower for about 10 minutes before it was hot - which would have been nice to know ahead of time. there was a lot of construction going on in the building and thus lots of construction noise and debris. the only positive part was the girl at the front desk was very nice and helpful and there was free wi-fi - an exception for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but in the dark!”
Reviews.Author: the4poles
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Hotel is central and within 5 mins walk from the central railway station with direct links to Fiumicino airport. - Friendly welcome upon arriving - the receptionist gave us a quick brief on the sights upon arriving as well as a list of recommended restaurants and wine bars. - The hotel also has a internet enabled desktop computer with printer in the hotel lounge, which was great to do some last minute research into tour availability and bookings. - The room was clean and had tea and coffee making facilities, although these were not replenished during our stay - we replenished our supplies from breakfast. - The room also included a flat screen TV with Sky (as expected there were only about half dozen English speaking channels), Playstation 2 with games and DVDs available from Reception (we watched a classic Will Smith weepie) and free WiFi. - The breakfast buffet should suit everybody's taste - thanks to previous reviewers we requested cappuccino coffee rather than drinking the coffee from the vending machine. Negatives: - The room was dark as it was on the ground floor on the inside of the building - we had to have lights on all the time and even then they were only just good enough to read. - Our room was at the end of a corridor near the basement stairs to the breakfast room and other ancillary facilities, as such it was noisy on most days from about 5 am with cleaning staff followed by guests taking early breakfast. - There was not always hot water available in the evenings, but never any shortage in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Rex hotel rome”
Reviews.Author: jonny34
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights,July 6&72011 Friendly staff . Great value close to Rome termini. Which we took to civitaecchia (sp) port for our cruise. Would recommend for short stays. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Boulderite32
Reviews.Content: Really nice room in a well kept hotel. This was one of the best hotel values that I've found in Europe with very helpful and appreciative staff (not always the case in Rome!). Very nice breakfast, very good location. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: Talvi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rex for 4 nights in April. I was travelling with a friend. I agree with most of the reviewers here: Rex is a nice little hotel with an extremely friendly and helpful staff. I wouldn't quite give it 4 stars though, I think it's more of a 3-star hotel. Location: - We walked almost everywhere (except the Vatican city), but the stations are conveniently near as well. The neighbourhood seemed quite "normal" despite of Termini station being fairly close. We didn't see anything scary/suspicious, not even late at night. But I would still consider staying in the very city centre the next time i visit Rome. We did a _lot_ of walking in 5 days, and it would have been nice to stay even closer to the main sights. Breakfast: - Breakfast was ok but didn't have as many varieties as in some bigger hotels. They ran out of basic stuff (like bread) a couple of times though it wasn't even very late yet. Cappuccino / Café Latte was fresh and delicious. Rooms: - We made our reservation through a website that didn't provide choice between double room and twin room. We were placed in a room with a double bed but didn't mind because it was more spacious than the twin rooms available at the moment. Our room was a bit lame but very clean and large enough. There was a sitting area as well as a writing desk, and enough space for our clothes (and shopping bags!). Bathroom was fairly large but a bit aged. On some days, it took ages and ages to get hot water from the shower/bath. A small minus was that the lighting was so dim it was very difficult to do a makeup - a small but important issue on a girls' holiday! Also, the weather was so warm (25 C on most days) that it would have been nice to open the windows once in a while, but this was not possible. They did have an aircon but it was not quite as effective as one might hope. Staff: We found every member of the staff friendly, helpful and considerate. Great staff is clearly what makes Hotel Rex worth staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelAddicts2
Reviews.Content: The Rex is very close to Stazione Termini, centered between two metro stops, and just a short walk to restaurants, shopping and the Colosseum. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was large and quiet. The free WiFi worked well throughout the hotel. Breakfast was good despite the instant coffee (order a cappuccino or latte instead). The only other minor negatives were the less than optimal air conditioning and a maintenance issue which was resolved within 24 hours. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Secon visit to this hotel. Excellent location friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: DaneNWUk
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for the second time in June. We received a warm welcome from the reception staff. The room was clean and the air conditioning worked well which was essential in the 30 degree temperatures. The room wasn't massive but was comfortable and the bath room cool marble and clean with excellent toiletries. Breakfast was one of the nicest we've had in Italy a good tip though is not to get your coffee from the self service machine but to ask one of the very friendly waiting staff for a cappuccino or espresso and they will happily make you a fresh one at no extra charge. Overall a very nice and comfortable stay and will definitely return on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Unreservedly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JandHDurham
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second trip to the Rex, and were not disappointed. Centrally located, clean and comfortable - and a kettle! What more could you want? There is some building work being carried out, but in no way did this affect the guests, and the staff could not have been more helpful. Nothing was too much trouble, and they are very well informed. The breakfasts were excellent - fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereals, toast, cooked meats, cheese and cake. All in all an excellent trip and we look forward to a third visit. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuardMusic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights (May 8-11, 2011) as part of a university study abroad. (I was one of 2 staff leading a group of 16 students.) Located near the Termini (main train/metro station), so very convenient to get around the city, but not necessarily in walking distance to main sites. It is only a couple of blocks from a piazza that offered convenience stores, counter and table service restaurants (local and McDonalds), and plenty of gelato shops! We all loved all the food we had for our entire stay! Most locals did not speak English, but we still did ok. Some restaurants even had English menus. A bank with an international ATM was right across the street. The Hotel Rex is NOT appropriate for someone with physical challenges, as there were stairs into the hotel, as well as to our room floor (located between two primary floors). The hotel is divided in two halves from the reception desk; you cannot get from one side to the other without going down to the reception, across, and back up. There are a few "split" floors that made it very confusing to find others in our group. While at least one elevator was working during our entire stay; they were working on one in the afternoon, which presented loud banging (hammer on steel) in a large portion of the hotel. The elevator also did not have the usual safety feature, so if you stuck your arm in to hold the door, it would smash your arm! This hotel would likely be rated a 2 Star in the states - just the basics, not even a vending machine. My single room was very much like a single room in a university residence hall. The bed was clean and comfy. The bathroom also clean and the newest part of the entire room. Like all of Europe, there are no outlets (other than one for razors) in the bathroom. The shower had clear glass, so plenty of light and an adjustable shower head. There was also a towel heater. Also like most European hotels, they do not have washcloths. The room offered a smallish (21"?) flat screen TV and a PlayStation. The only English channel was BBC World. The front desk had free DVD rentals for use on the PlayStation, which I did use (Mission: Impossible and Minority Report). The room keys (yes, key - not card) are on a HUGE & HEAVY key chain, as they make you turn in your key every time you leave the hotel. There is NO air conditioning in the entire hotel, even though there was a locked panel on the wall. It was quite warm during our stay (high 70s/low 80s) and just opening the window was not enough for me. (I like to sleep at about 65F). Thankfully, I brought a Vornado travel fan and sleeping pills! The hotel does have a very small outdoor patio off the 2nd floor. Unfortunately my room was across from it and a noisy group kept me away/awoke me from a dead sleep at 2am. I had to call the front desk and they did deal with the noisy group. All of the furniture, carpet, & wallpaper looked very old, perhaps from the 70s and was in poor shape/coming apart. There was a safe in the closet, but I did not use it. The included breakfast was quite good (meats, breads, pastries, cereals, coffee, juices, and plenty of Nutella!), the single egg dish was consistently cold. Although the breakfast room was hidden in the basement, it's bright decor & white furniture brought a lovely kitchen feel. This is very much a "group booking" hotel for international travelers. Besides my American group, there was also a group of Asians. I never heard a single Italian person, other than the staff for our entire visit. The staff was quite helpful and was able to negotiate English pretty well (except for the tech who had to fix the PlayStation). The included wi-fi was spotty. Some afternoons it worked fine, while some evenings it was totally offline. One day I couldn't get the wi-fi to work, so I went down to use the one Apple computer in the "waiting room". Apparently their entire system, including the staff computers were offline. It took 4-5 hours for the service to be reinstated. While we loved Rome, if/when I return, I will not stay at Hotel Rex. I am simply accustomed to a higher-level hotel, such as Marriott in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great and very rigid about "the rules"”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalCruiser
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor. They claim to be a 4 star hotel (which means you pay a higher city tax), but they really are not. It seemed shabby as a whole. We missed our flight to Rome and called booking.com, through which we made the reservation. The hotel didn't cancel us for the second night, but they made us pay for the first night. They required 3 days' notice, which is impossible when you miss a flight. The people at the hotel were pleasant enough but rigid about "the rules." They claim to have upgraded us, so the room was bigger than we paid for, but the air conditioning barely worked and clearly wasn't worth 198 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: ColleenMaitland
Reviews.Content: This is a less then average hotel, carpets were stained, small rooms. The only good thing is the location, close to the attractions. We made the mistake that breakfast was free, and to our surprise we were charged 4 euros each for a breakfast that was subpar. We could of had good coffe and a pastry at a coffee shop for the same price, so pass on the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not worth of 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: mentha1
Reviews.Content: Good: - friendly super good staff - nice price - location - cleaning - staff, have to be mentioned again Bad: - Breakfast: No vegetables (like tomatoes etc.) served at all - Room was definitely not worth of 4 stars, I would say 3 stars. Bathroom was good. - Soundproofing, get your earplugs with you if you are not a good sleeper. After all: I would recommend. Good price-quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, little bit weathered staff go out of there way to help”
Reviews.Author: frankcapra
Reviews.Content: great hotel close to the train station, the room was a little but tatty in places but there was a lot of maintenance being carried out while we where there, so hopefully it wont look as tired in the near future, staff where great and the selection of free DVDs and PS2 games was a nice extra. wouldnt think twice about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin...”
Reviews.Author: Clifftopman
Reviews.Content: Had 3 days here with my newly qualified nurse daughter who needed a break, and who had never been to Rome before. A small hotel with a big heart. The staff could not have been more helpful. We had a twin en suite room that had two very comfortable beds...big TV...and free wi-fi that worked very well. An adequate buffet breakfast of yoghurts, cereals, croissants, cold meats etc. and lost of good restaurants around for the evening. Very well situated for all the obvious sites. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: Smiley-Caz
Reviews.Content: We staid at The Rex for 4 nights and we liked it. The location is in easy reach of the Metro and main train station. Before going we read that the area near the train station is to be avoided. I think this may be true of the area directly around the train station but the area around the hotel is just fine and we walked from it to all of the main attractions. So why did we like it... - It has a personal feel to it, you know you are not stopping in a chain hotel - The bar area is lovely and the drink prices reasonable - Near the bar there is also lovely library area with games and a cinema room, on one of the nights they were doing tango lessons in the cinema room - The reasonable location as mentioned - The breakfast room is pleasant and the selection of food on offer was fine to get a bit of some thing inside you before you explore the streets of Rome - The room was spacious - There was adequate space to put your cases ( we often find in hotels you have to leave them in a walkway) - The mini fridge in the room actually kept the drinks cold - The wifi was free and code given with out having to request it - Free safe - And the best thing for us was the bed was massive and wonderfully comfy. We had the best nights sleep we have probably ever had in a hotel I think Trip Advisor can bring out the Hotel Inspector in you and in this respect there were a couple of things that could have been improved but on the whole we were really happy with the hotel. Just in case they help you decide whether to book or not the things that could be improved were... - The bathroom tiles around the shower and bath were a bit grimey and mouldy - There was a sewage smell in the bathroom. It did improve if we left the toilet seat lid down. But if we forgot the smell was pretty strong. (We didn't mention this to any of the staff) - There was no outside window in the room, there was a window but it opened on to what looked like the lift shaft. As we were there in Winter it wasn't such an issue for us but I would like to be in the room we stopped in if it was warmer. Some rooms did have outside windows though As mentioned these things did not spoil our stay and all in we were happy with the Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel, Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SHOPnDINE
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Rex Hotel in Rome during our stay in August 2010 was so memorable that we did not hesitate to return during our next visit in November the same year. Not only was the location convenient and accessible for Train, metro and bus but it is also a walking distance from the shopping area and most of the tourist site. We enjoyed our stay there every time. Compared to other hotels we stayed at in Italy that year, the rooms are very spacious, clean and welcoming. They even have a playstation and a mac setup in each room! The staff at the hotel was friendly and welcome even before we arrived there. They offer the possibility of calling them directly through skype which is practically cost free. We called them the first time to confirm the details as it was our first time in Rome. Most of the staff speaks very good English and did not hesitate to answer our questions. They offer airport pickup and drop off which is very convenient for tourists like us and cheaper than taking the train. During our second stay we arrived by train from Firenze so we simply walked to the hotel which is minutes away from the train station. Our reservation included breakfast which is served is a modest but clean basement area. It was a breaskfast buffet offering a variety of continental choices. The food was simple but tasty. We especially enjoyed the homemade cappuccino they served us in conveniently large bowls. During our first stay, we arrived late afternoon and did not have any plans for sightseeing. The staff at the front desk were pleasant enough to give us direction to a family owned restaurant near by where we enjoyed the most delicious authentic Italian food. We had pleasant memories at Hotel Rex and would not hesitate to recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: boozymoose
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Really helpful, got everything you want for a romantic trip away or a trip with the family or for anyone wishing to do some great site seeing. Started with arriving. Great location walking distance from the central station and a pleasant welcome at the reception. Their English was very good and describe where all the restaurants was around the area and if they are good for cheap but cheerful or expensive but fine dining which was very useful. They also pointed out the local sights and the best way to get there. To get to the room we walked passed a beautiful children's play room and was led to the room. Included in the room is a play station with a selection of DVDs and games to choose from (kept downstairs) an Apple computer with internet connection, WiFi Sky Television (the only English channel is world news), iPad is available to rent at 25 euro. Fresh coffee in the morning with your continental buffet. At the reception is a computer with a printer and a well priced bar. Sorry but can't give you many bad points. Things I did not use so can comment on is the Gym and Wii console.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and suitable hotel”
Reviews.Author: patsutley79
Reviews.Content: i was there for 4 nights after a long trip with my girl...we don't use to write reviews, this is my first time in tripadvisor. i have to write something about the Rex. this is an hotel that you can call Home. all the staff really friendly and helpful with our needs! a great breakfast, good service. free internet connection, a must! our was a little room, well cleaned and really comfortable. i loved their gym! everyday at the reception desk there were homemade sweet, something i've never seen before! i will come back for sure next year. Rome is amaizing and the Rex makes your stay even more beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “It was worth the wait !”
Reviews.Author: Pictonlads
Reviews.Content: After 20 years, we had saved our penny's and headed to Rome, we arrived late at night, travel weary and grumpy, from the minute we stepped over the threshhold of the Hotel Rex everything changed, the holiday had begun. The room was quiet, very clean and classicly styled,the staff were absolutely awesome, Special Mention to Oneida !!! She runs the kitchen and our day started with her smile and her food, it was seriously hard to leave this gorgeous hotel, our main peice of advice is this, expect nothing when you travel and the great people at the Rex will surprise you with their warmth, generosity and their ability to make your holiday worth remembering.

Reviews.Title: “Finding this gem alone makes Tripadviser an essential”
Reviews.Author: RonG3
Reviews.Content: My friend had never been to Italy, so where better to start than Rome? Rome's expensive, so I hunted around and found this hotel recommended here. All I can say is thank you, Tripadviser. The location is superb - within five minutes walk of both the Metro lines and the main bus station, within fifteen of the Colosseum, Forum, etc. Yet it's quiet. The room looked a shade dingy, but I suspect that's the chosen forties decor about which I don't particualarly enthuse. Actually there was little wrong with it. Niggles like non-functional a/c, but who cares about that in November? Smoke could be smelt drifting in the open window and the bathroom door wouldn't open fully. No mouse with the iMac in our room made it unusable - we didn't actually tell anyone about any of these things. In other respects the room was excellent - very wide, very comfortable bed, decent bath and so-so shower, large flat-screen TV with Sky and a playstation [games available at no charge], A4 sized print-out of the previous days newspaper front page [The Times for UK guests]. Downstairs there was a library, children's playrooms, computer and printer. The staff we came across all spoke English and were very helpful. Breakfast was [I thought] excellent; however my friend as a nearly-vegetarian didn't want cereals unless the milk was fully skimmed, didn't want jams and cakes and so she just chose fruit. The only fruit was grapes. We paid less than 1/6 of the rack rate on the back of the door. If I ever go to Rome again, I'll be back at the Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great staff”
Reviews.Author: rolojef
Reviews.Content: Very good place to stay for a short city break. Ideal location near to the centre but quiet at night for a good sleep. Staff make you feel very welcome and are very helpful with tourist information. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rex was our home during the ash cloud.”
Reviews.Author: MMGMayo
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in rome during the ash cloud. We had already enjoyed a few days in hotel Rex. We were very fairly and pleasently treated when our stay had t be extended on a day by day basis. The computer with free internet access and TV in the room provided us with information updates and the computer with a free printer in the library was great for printing out our new tickets. The staff, the room, the breakfast, and fruit and cakes at reception all contributed to making us fell safe and secure during the unusual situation in which we found ourselves. We thoroughly recommend it as a place to stay. You could not ask for better.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are excellent; location first class”
Reviews.Author: kdplusfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with a group of three friends. The one thing I would really want to emphasise about this hotel is the staff who are extremely friendly and very helpful. Bedrooms we were allocated are smaller than we have been used to elsewhere but rooms were clean & comfortable and gave us what we were after - a clean bed for the night. Breakfast was included in our rate and was more than adequate, served in a pleasant basement dining area - request a latte or cappuccino and it will be delivered to your table. Hotel bar is on the small side but a relaxing area for a quiet drink after a days sightseeing and serves beer, wine and spirits . The hotel is ideally located - an easy walk to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Colloseum. Very convenient to Termini and both Metro lines - useful if you want to travel to the Vatican or beyond. The hotel is situated in a quiet street close to Via Nazionale and there are a good selection of restaurants nearby. Recommend Antica Boheme a short walk away - traditional Roman fare and reasonably priced and don't let the small frontage put you off. Complimentary computer available near reception for free web access and printing boarding cards etc. Hotel also has free wifi though we didn't use this facility so can't comment on quality. Apple iPad available for rent at reception - 25 euro per day. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel if what you are after is a reasonable, convenient hotel to serve as a base for a sightseeing visit to this amazing City.

Reviews.Title: “All Fur Coat”
Reviews.Author: ianandnoelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, 3 nights one week and returned following week for 1 night prior to trip home. Very nice foyer and public areas but room very dated, carpet stained, wall paper peeling. No tea making facilities available. TV difficult to use and very few English channels. No remote for TV. Didn't use mini bar but nuts and crisps were left out as though complimentary. Used these and was charged - no warning of charge anywhere. Staff pleasant but English a bit dodgy! Took my credit card payment for second stay before I arrived - very annoying. Overall would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: u03awh
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and were greeted by the friendly reception staff. They provided us with a map of Rome and pointed out all the relevant sites and how to get there. Anytime we needed advice or help, the staff were more than willing to help. The room wasnt exactly 5 star but the beds were comfy and the room was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Overall The Rex is ...Okay”
Reviews.Author: jerseysl33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room at the "Top of the Rex" which was very unique. The large outdoor terrace was really nice, although it seemed that all of the rooms with outdoor space shared the same terrace. The terrace areas specific to each room were blocked off with flower planters and such, so I'd suggest if you want a very private or intimate balcony go elsewhere, although for our group of friends celebrating a birthday it was perfect. There was plenty of terrace space that included a dining table, basketball hoop, lounge chairs and a broken foosball table. Inside the room was not spotless, but relatively clean and comfortable. The shower was large and sophisticated, though hard to get in and out of and difficult to use. The room seemed to have many high-tech features, but no info on how to use them so we didn't really take advantage of that. The closet in the room was AMAZING. It was a walk in closet, with unbelievable amounts of space for our things, but clearly it didn't get much use and was somewhat dusty. The bed left a lot to be desired, but didn't prevent me from getting a good night's sleep. Our mini fridge was restocked each day when the room was cleaned, but I don’t think there was anything to drink besides water and maybe PowerAde or something like it. No biggie though- the hotel bar was small but nice, although it seemed like the person working the front desk at night was sometimes also the bartender. The staff was nice upon checking us in, but we encountered several issues which could have been avoided. Twice the front desk relayed a message left with them for us incorrectly, and they gave us a hard time about one member of our party joining us late. We were supposed to have an extra bed in our room on the last night for him, but they claimed to never have known this was the case. First the man at the front desk said he didn't know where the cots were kept, then it was that he was alone and couldn't leave to get it for us, then he tried to say it wouldn't fit in the room... there was a million excuses this guy came up with as to why there was no place for him to sleep. Our friend ended up paying for a single room at a discounted rate, but by the time this was settled it was too late for us to go out anywhere, which really put a damper on our last night in the eternal city. This place was in a very good location- right near a beautiful old church and within walking distance to Termini, but tucked on a quiet side street out of the way. If I ever go back to Rome, I'd probably try and stay somewhere else just to try something new, but our experience at the Rex was by no means "terrible"... just not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean and unhygenic”
Reviews.Author: nana034
Reviews.Content: Very filthy rooms and bathrooms. Elevator is so freaking small, slow and old and seem like you will be stuck there and suffocate. Staff is friendly but would never recommend to anyone who is looking for clean and hate filthy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huddersfield
Reviews.Content: The Rex is the place to stay especially if its your first time in Rome. Superb location, close to the opera house, and the transport centre at termini. The jewel of this hotel is its staff. They are excellent, very helpful, informative and will advise you what to do, see, etc. They even set up the wi fi for me to work free of charge in the hotel in case someone was using the computer which if free for any resident to use. Large rooms with high ceilings (though a little tired and dark) with good bathrooms. Not 4* in the room department but a good 3*, but a 5* in service! Will be going back again which in the end says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lucysrussell
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with very friendly staff. A good breakfast compared to other Italian hotels Ive stayed in. This hotel excells itself on the little touches with chocs on arrival and a welcome postcard on our pillow. A wonderful place for kids with a cinema, kids room and playstation for them to play on. Couldnt reccommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: terry056
Reviews.Content: great location good breakfast. room a little old fashioned .and could bo with tea making facilities.staff very helpfull and a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Angelzoey2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex is a great little hotel only a couple blocks from Termini Station. The location made all of the main sites in Rome accessible to us. You could also walk to the Coliseum as it is only a 15 minute walk away. Breakfast was great. Eggs, bacon, yogurt, pastries, cereal, fruit, etc. Definitely a good way to start the day. The rooms were a little small and need to be updated. The carpetting was covered with stains, but the room was clean. The beds were also comfortable. The only negative I have about the hotel is the air conditioner. Even with the air cranked all the way up at the coldest setting, it was pretty warm in our room. The hotel staff told us there is only one AC for the entire hotel, which is why it's not very cold. It was very, very hot when we were in Rome, so this made the room uncomfortable. Our AC also made an annoying creaking noise and when we asked the hotel to come look at it, they're solution was for us to turn the air conditioner on low and to set it to a warmer setting, which made the sound go away. Great idea when it was already warm! But that's Italy for you!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying at Hotel Rex”
Reviews.Author: kimw
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here one night before going on a cruise. It was easy to find from the Termini. We walked with our large suitcases, took about 10 minutes with the bags. It is only a few blocks from the metro station, we went to the Repubblica stop which was convenient. The best part of the hotel was we booked a double room for 114 euros and somehow we ended up with the suite room at the top floor. We had a private terrace area and it was very spacious. We didn't use the kitchen or sitting area, but it was a nice room and was clean. The bed was comfortable. Also, it was nice they had free Wi-Fi, you just have to ask at the desk for the password but it works in the rooms too, not just the lobby. The breakfast was just ok, but I am not really into any of the european style hotel breakfasts. The lady working in the dining area was very friendly though. The staff at the desk were friendly too. We would have stayed here the day after our cruise but we did not book at same time and the price had more than doubled. I would recommend especially at the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel But Service was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MaryOviedo
Reviews.Content: If you are truly looking for a 4 star hotel, Hotel Rex is not it. The rooms are run down, in need of paint and new carpeting, badly. For the price we paid $339 Euros, it should have been better. However, I will say, that the staff was exceptional. They were helpful, in every respect. They went out of their way to assist us with any issues, questions, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!Staff are great. Very...”
Reviews.Author: Faspina
Reviews.Content: Great location! Staff are great. Very friendly and helpful. The included breakfast is simple but tasty. It was great to have bacon & eggs included in the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: sgreenwood
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Rex. The close proximity to Termini (5 min walk) was great. I rode the subway many times so it was great to be able to run back to the hotel for a break or a change of clothes without wasting too much time. The room was decent sized, though pretty plain. It was quiet at night and I slept pretty well here. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChestaCopperpot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Rex, having searched all over the internet for a reasonably priced hotel. The Hotel Rex was around £90 a night, cheap for Rome, ad seemed to be in a reasonable location. On our arrival we got a Terravision Coach from Ciampino Airport which dropped us off at the main Train Station in Rome. This was at most a 10 minute walk to the hotel. Perfect in my eyes for arriving and departing. Everything else was a nice walk away, and considering everything in Rome is more or less "Historic" you end up falling over lovely Churches and Piazzas enroute to the main attractions. Also around the Hotel were a couple of lovely restaurants, Cotto being our personal favourite. The staff at the hotel were lovely. As an ignorant English couple we struggled with the language, but the staff quite happily switched to English and appreciated our effort. All the staff we dealt with were extremely helpful and friendly and couldn't ask for much more. The room itself was large, and spacious. It had a lcd v with Sky TV, a PS2 and DVD player. Bathroom was okay. It was large and clean but could probably do with an upgrade really. Did the job for us though. We chose breakfast one morning which was 10 euros each. It did have a large selection of cakes, pastries, cereals and hot food, but was abit steep really for what you end up eating. All in all the the Hotel Rex provided us with a fantastic base from which to see Rome, and I would recommend it to any of my friends planning on visiting the City. Thanks to the Hotel Rex for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: TL13
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with my wife and friends for a long weekend and loved every minute of my stay there. Rome is a beautiful city to explore and the only negative is that it is very expensive. To get around I would recommend buying a Roma Pass - this gets you into two museums/attractions on the list and free metro and buses for three days. We thought that was great value. As for the Rex, this is a nice hotel near to Termini so the location is very convenient if you are coming in by train from the airport. The staff were always pleasant and we were checked in very quickly. Our room was a little small and our bathroom had a shower only, but it was spotlessly clean. We had breakfast included with our deal and it was €10.00 if you didn't. I thought this was quite reasonable when considering the prices outside. Unfortunately, the basement room where you ate was devoid of any atmosphere and did not encourage long lingering breakfasts which we enjoy. The food itself was okay but nothing special and in the three days we did not hang about too long. Overall nice, but nothing special and certainly not 4*

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dban
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, nice location close to the train station. Nice decorations in the room. Very spacious rooms

Reviews.Title: “Oasis near Termini”
Reviews.Author: ramnastacks
Reviews.Content: Although the décor of the bedroom was in need of some attention, nothing was too awful that it marred our three night stay here. The room was clean with fresh bedding each day and clean towels unless you are environmentally concious and choose otherwise. The bed was comfortable and the pillows sumptuous. The bathroom had an adequate shower even if the sliding door and tiles needed some TLC. I was glad I had taken my own hair dryer because the one supplied was in the bathroom - the tube version - fairly hopeless unless you have very short hair! The toiletries supplied are really basic, so if you like pampering take your own. The map from their website I didn't find clear enough in giving directions from Termini so make sure you go right through from the Leonardo Express platform to the very front of the station (a fair walk) and then it really is a 5 minute easy walk as the web site suggests! The public areas are welcoming and have style! The staff very friendly and helpful indeed and breakfast was plentiful with the usual supply of buffet: cereal; hot eggs/bacon; pastries; toast; cold meats; cheeses; spreads; fresh fruit/juices. It is well situated and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Good Value But Not Quite 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: JimmyTheBairn
Reviews.Content: Mostly positives with this hotel including convenience of location, service, general cleanliness, room size & comfort, breakfast, TV channel choice, library, kids play room, movie room, weather forecast in lift, and nibbles/fruit laid on at reception. Negatives would be the small bathroom size, bathroom fittings/lay-out, and high uncontrollable room temperature (not practical to leave the window open for long during freezing February nights) Overall more than satisfactory for the price paid (90 euros for two B&B) but it just doesn't have that 4 star feel about it so try not to pay 4 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not what you imagine for 4 Star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lotte32
Reviews.Content: I recently went for a long weekend with my husband to Rome and we stayed at The Rex. It's our last trip as a couple, we are expecting our first child in June! We booked through Airmiles and stayed at The Rex as this was part of an offer they were running, rather than our choice. As it was billed as central and four star, we thought it was ideal. Our room was quite small, very dark, the bathroom was small, basic, and a little dated. There was a tv with basic sky news and bbc world news, plus a playstation 2 with game and dvd's available through reception. However, don't forget to ask for the controller. The main problem was the heating was unbearable. It was switched on to the maximum without any ability for us to control the temperature. We asked three time for this to be attended to and we were told it was unable to be fixed and we were suggested to sleep with the balcony doors open. This meant that at 5am every morning we awoke to the sound of the market in the opposit street being set up with reversing lorries making deliveries and scaffolding being erected for the stalls. Not ideal! The breakfast was included and this was served in a basement room. It was very bright and clean, the service was excellent. There was a selection of ham, cheeses, croissants, rolls and toast. Fresh juices were also available. The waitress offers coffee, or there was an automatic machine. The location is about a ten minute walk to the Termini (where the main Airport trains run to). This is useful when visiting any of the main tourist locations as both the A and B metro trains run from here. However, be aware of pickpockets & beggers in the termini building. There are a few restaurants nearby, however, there isn't a great selection, try nearer to the main attractions. Fir sport fans there is an Irish pub almost opposite the entrance to the Via Torino from the main road that is friendly and shows English football games, as well as Rugby. All in all, The Rex is a good place to stay in terms of location. However, don't expect 4 star luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and comfortable hotel which offers great value for money”
Reviews.Author: TMOC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Rex while visiting Rome on a long weekend and thought it was fantastic. It’s very convenient location wise (few minutes walk from the main Termini metro & rail station) and close enough to the main tourist attractions to walk (we made it to the Colosseum in a 15 minute stroll). It had the facilities I would expect from a 4 star such as a TV, minibar and safe in our room, ensuite bathroom with branded toiletries, good breakfast, and bar just off the reception area. In addition, there were also some really nice touches which really added to our stay and suggested that the hotel has put some thought into providing a goodservice, including fruit and cakes in the reception area for guests, WI FI in our room, weather forecasts placed in the lifts (very helpful as the weather was a bit variable over the course of the weekend), a games room, a TV room and a children’s play area. We found the staff really friendly and helpful (the lady in the breakfast room apologised to us on our last day as they’d had an influx of guests the day before and we were unable to sit at the table we’d sat at for the previous two mornings!) and the hotel is extremely clean. Overall, this is a really welcoming and comfortable hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great quality/price value!!!”
Reviews.Author: EaglegirlStorm
Reviews.Content: We have just been in this hotel and had a great time. The service, the room, the food and staff were great. The room was VERY clean (!), what we really liked and it had a beautiful interiour. There was a WiFi connection available and we even recieved the front of one of the newspapers in our country every day! There is also digital tv, so you can watch a lot of different things. The best thing about this hotel is the location. The hotel is located in the middle of the old part in Rome and is near to a metrostation and the central station. You can find everything in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “convenient but no more than 3 stars at best”
Reviews.Author: Daveyh_London
Reviews.Content: Handy if you get the train into Rome, only a few blocks easy walking. Nothing much around the area itself to speak of though, about 30-45 mins walk in town 'town' , say Argentina square, colleseum probable closest landmark about 30 mins walk away. Very close to public transport, the underground which we used all the time with our Roma pass which is a must if staying more than a day or so. The sites usually only a few underground stops from the hotel or a 20 mins bus ride to city centre. Staff are ok , not rude but nothing special, same as the room, its supposed to be 4 star but ours was not. Clean but dated. Smallish bathroom for a 3 bed room we thought but kinda similar around europe really. Thats all it was, a room with 3 single beds for 3 of us but for what we paid it was ok as got a discount thru our booking website. Annoying we only had 2 cups and 2 wine glasses in the room and they did not replace them with clean ones in morning when the cleaners came through.
