Did have a nice very juliet balcony though from which we could open the doors and watch the goings on at street level. Overall ok for the price for Rome in september. Try elsewhere. Do get the Roma pass, Rome is awesome, literally, though restaurant staff are very rude and Rome is very expensive for food and alcohol when out . A truly great city though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hidden gem, great location”
Reviews.Author: 64yonanny
Reviews.Content: We booked the Rex for our last night of a 3 week holiday in Europe and we were delighted to find we were upgraded to a rooftop unit with sitting room and kitchen . It was wonderful to be able to have the room to repack our luggage for our flight home. The staff were lovely, very helpful and the breakfast was excellent

Reviews.Title: “good for students or budget travel”
Reviews.Author: clancyaustin
Reviews.Content: we were spoiled by our great location and fantastic stay at another hotel on the first part of our trip. When we returned to Rome to fly out the next morning, we wanted something closer to the train station. This hotel was in the more modern area of Rome. We had been in the historic district. This area felt more threatening and dirty. the hotel had a great breakfast in a cute room, and our room was big, but it seemed dirty - not the sheets, but the walls, carpet, grout, etc. that said, for the price, it was probably good. We would spend the extra money to stay somewhere nicer the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great staff and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rszasz
Reviews.Content: I liked the location a 10 minutes walk from Rome Termini Station and close to Metro and bus stations. The location is also within walking distance to Piazza Republica and other attractions as listed on the Hotel site description.We have also enjoyed the breakfast which was great and the staff was very nice. The hotel is located in a very nice old building and the upgrade we have got for a suite was a large size room with king bed and good size and modern bathroom. We did not like the street noise which could be heard even with closed windows. The air conditioning was not cooling enough. The computer in the room with free internet is a nice feature but unfortunately did not work.However there is a computer with free internet in the lobby which we could use instead .

Reviews.Title: “wasnt fussed on rome bit smelly and dirty but hotel lovely”
Reviews.Author: rullis
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel and it was lovely! very centralized! but take a map with you from home as soon as you get off the bus at termini you 'll need a map to find it! its literally 5mins from the main termini station. from the hotel you can walk everywhere. furthest attraction is the Vatican but again only took 30-40 mins walk. hotel staff were very friendly and hotel was clean and had everything you needed for a stay in room. i would recommend the hotel but Rome just wasn't for us! a lot of graffiti and homeless people!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RookiesUSA
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in Room 220 with no view, but in the back so very quiet. Plenty of space with two twin beds and large bathroom with tub. Front desk staff very helpful, especially Laura. Most staff spoke very good English. Easy to understand. Walking distance to Termini. Breakfast every morning of breads, meats, cheese and scrambled eggs and ham. Very enjoyable stay, safe environment even after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Nice Rooms, just perfect :-)”
Reviews.Author: Kit0405
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a central location and it's not far to either underground or bus stations (it's also close to the train station Termini). The room was very nice and clean. What I liked best was the very friendly and helpful staff, they helped with my suitcase, and gave me good tips how to get where. They had A3 size city maps with pictures of buildings etc. at the reception desk where they marked what I needed to know, so this was very helpful when you are in Rome for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Europegoer
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Rex. Room was clean and spacious enough for 3 people. Fairly good breakfast. Extremely helpful staff that speaks good English. The best part is the location. It's walking distance to Termini and yet far from the noice. It takes 5 minutes to walk to Metro and bus stops (use 40 and 64 to all the sites including Vatican) or 15-20 minutes walk to the forum and neighboring sites. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and even better service”
Reviews.Author: cipindc
Reviews.Content: For a visit in Rome, this hotel offers you what you need. Clean rooms, very helpful staff, excellent breakfast spread. The staff went beyond the call of duty in helping me communicate with the airline about my lost luggage. Also their lounge area was very nice. On the nights I was there, people were either hanging out and chatting or being entertained by kids running around. It is easy to get around from the hotel - by picking up subway or catching buses. Only few blocks from train station so no need to get a cab if you don't have lots of luggage to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the easy life at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TheBrannigans
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Lovely reception area. Nice clean bedroom and en suite. Fresh. Staff were more than helpful when they knew my case was delayed. Pretty central for almost everything. Bus tours at end of street. McDonalds at other end. Surrounded by restaurants - Good restaurants. We only used the hotel for sleeping and breakfast. Breakfast was a buffet with plenty selection. Lots of fruit. It's not a 5 star hotel but we were definitely impressed with the whole place. The staff were lovely too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value central location”
Reviews.Author: PaulD_05
Reviews.Content: It was clean and comfortable. Excellent value. Handy for Public Transport with good restaurants nearby. The breakfast (at 10 Euros per person) was pretty reasonable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelnut360
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rex for five nights. Basic but clean rooms and the reception people are very helpful. Close to the train station and walking distance to almost everything. Would not hesitate to stay here again. Hotel is basic, no pool or gym but price wise for Rome, it is good.

Reviews.Title: “Room Smelt a bit..... Funky”
Reviews.Author: KatesGotTheTravelBug
Reviews.Content: The Big plus at the Rex is the Staff, they were so friendly and helpful and they were very very approachable for assistance. Our room smelt like smoke.. or smoke that has tried to be covered up, so a musty smoke room hehe You only notice the smell when you first walk in, after 10 minutes or so you get used to the smell. the room otherwise was fine, the bathroom was very clean. We had pay tv over there which was good to chill out too before going too bed (i think its called Sky TV there?) Downstairs they have an internet room, where you have to pay for an hour session at the front desk, and a little play room for kids, which i spose would be good for people travelling with youngens. The Hotel had a bar! (also sold little icecreams lol) the Breakfasts where in the Basement, which was different, but i didnt eat any of the food so i couldnt say how it was, however it looked alright. Every weekday there is a market in the street near the hotel, which was good to go to, i bought some clothes there. Go to the Rex if you want super friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel from which to explore a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: WeeZipper
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, conveniently 5 minutes walk from the Termini rail station. There is a metro stops close by for easy access across the city. We stayed for 3 nights at the end of July '09, and found it to be an easy hotel to reach following our transfer from the airport to the Termini. It is also not too far to walk to the famous sights within the city (approx 20 mins walk to the Trevi fountain, 25 mins to the Pantheon). Our room was well cleaned and spacious. Complete with satellite tv, Playstation 2 and Mac computer! Good air-con to help escape from the mid-30's temperatures! The staff were always polite, friendly and helpful. The receptionists all spoke good English. I can honestly say that we wouldn't hesitate to stay again at this hotel when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: Dagers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at Hotel Rex. We have 3 children, and booked well in advance. For a rather low price through hotels.com, we got the perfect room for us - in fact, the best we've ever got anywhere, one that really suited our needs. The room was large, a 2-room apartment. Each of our children had a proper bed, and we got them to sleep so that we could spend time for ourselves before going to sleep - reading, watching tv, talking. This has been a problem earlier; rooms are too small, or you need to go to bed at 9 or 10 in the evening. The hotel was as centrally located as we could hope for. Staff was friendly and helpful, no problem for us who do not speak Italian. It had nice interior, room was clean and well kept. There was a playroom for the children. You could even borrow Playstation 2 games and play them in your room. The kids loved this, of course :-) So, in all, we were very, very happy with our choice of hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: brneyessc
Reviews.Content: Service was great. Very helpful and spoke Englilsh. Room (601) was pleasant. Nice size bathroom and the beds were comfortable. The only problems we had were the AC did not cool the room and the refrigerator in the room did not keep anything cold. I asked 3 times for someone to fix the frig and it did not happen. I also asked if the AC could get cooler...that was not done either. I spoke to another guest that was given a fan for their room. I would suggest asking for one when you check-in. Everything was clean and the hotel was within walking distance to everything. The computer in the room was ancient and did not work properly. I would stay here again, but would make sure I received a fan at check-in. One last thing, they did not have washclothes for the showers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: shaz893
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rex in July for a weekend break in Rome. I read the reviews on here and decided to book. The reception was friendly and we had someone take our luggage to our room. The rooms were bit on the small side and the view wasn't the best but the bathroom was large. The location of the hotel was fantastic we walked to the colleseum and trevi fountain/spainsh sterps were within walking distance. When we had problems with the transfer to the airport reception assisted us and made sure we got to the airport. Great service highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: JAFR
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, very good service, very friendly people. This is just the kind of hotel you want to stay in when traveling with your family.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT experience with Hotel Rex!”
Reviews.Author: ErinBearin
Reviews.Content: The concierge was fabulous, the room was clean and huge by European standards. Even big for American standards. The full breakfast was the best we've had anywhere, and the hotel is very convenient to the train station and METRO rail (5 mins walk). We would stay here again in a heartbeat it was a wonderful hotel! Restaurants nearby! Rooms came with reasonably priced minibar, LCD TVs, large closets, places to put 2 suitcases! They even left a welcome note for us on our arrival! The bed was plush and comfortable. The only downside was the AC wasn't as strong as we would have liked, but they brought us a large oscillating fan so it was comfortable even in late June/early July.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, central hotel - certainly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MHB48
Reviews.Content: We booked through Airmiles and as usual they did not disappoint! Within walking distance of Termini station (walk the length of the station inside instead of negotiating the paths and kerbs outside). Central for sightseeing, with most places within walking distance. Rooms clean, breakfast buffet consisted of hot and cold food, but the hotel's biggest asset is the exceptional helpful, pleasant staff. All speak fluent English, and nothing was too much trouble. Computer available to check in for return flights which made life much easier. All in all an excellent experience and one we would have no hesitation in repeating and recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “Could do with a good refurb!”
Reviews.Author: Esther1
Reviews.Content: Good points : Central, Friendly staff, Reasonable (for Rome I suppose) Bad points: Dingy room, Mould in bathroom, Dirty carpet, Tired looking

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rex hits the mark on service, location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroadagain703
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reviews from other travelers, we selected the Hotel Rex, near Termini rail station, for a reasonably priced overnight in Rome prior to boarding a cruise. We were very happy with the selection. Friendly staff, clean and well appointed room/bath, and good location made it an excellent choice for our short stay. We walked to the hotel from the station with rolling luggage - manageable walk, though we took a taxi on the return to Termini the following day. Not the most beautiful part of the city, of course, but just a 15 minute walk to the Colliseum and a few blocks to the bus stop, so we were very satisfied. The room faced another building, so no view, but also very quiet at night. We booked a standard double room and found a very nice king size bed - pleasant surprise. The room also had a Mac computer, internet access, flat screen TV, room safe and good sized closet. Bathroom was also a nice size and attractive. The breakfast was adequate with hot and cold foods - nothing terribly noteworthy - but it was enough to get us on our way. Front desk staff spoke perfect English and were friendly and very helpful with directions and other assistance. The room size might be an issue for a longer stay - but it was bigger than our cruise stateroom, so, no complaints! A good choice if you want to stay near Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Marja: This is the quiet&clean hotel, with good breakfast and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Darrya
Reviews.Content: - If you are looking for a place for your Rome exploring, this a worth to take a look, it's not a luxory resort for a honeymoon, but a good 4 star hotel. - Location is good, it's close to train station, but not too close:) - We walked from there to vatican (1 hour walk), colosseum, pantheon, everywhere - Staff is very friendly and helpful, thing that I appreciate very much - The room is not a luxory room, but there was enough space and it was CLEAN and quiet too. It's not like those many other hotels, located next to big noisy street. I tipped the cleaning lady for her effort :D - Breakfast was good... - The airconditioner was a bit noisy, but well, we survivied that and were glad that there was a airconditioner

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Rome - location/value/quality wise”
Reviews.Author: travelingteamduo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Hotel Rex on June 10, 11 and 12, as part of our honeymoon trip to Italy. We loved the hotel, the room, the location, everything. Rooms are decent size, clean, there's a nice writing desk as well, new furniture, and the bed is very comfortable. Nice bathroom, with an interesting shower cabin (it's true that the towel rack was kinda dusty, but we just didn't keep our towels on it). We loved the library, it's beautifully decorated and very romantic. There's a lot of detail attention in the lobby as well. Just love a hotel with personality! Hotel staff was just great, every single one of them; always with a smile, always ready to help you in every possible way. Location couldn't be better. Walking distance to all the attractions, close to Termini Station, on a quiet street though. We walked up and down Via Cavour several times, day and night, and felt really safe. A lot of good restaurants around the hotel. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel, so couldn't tell you anything about it. Couldn't get a better deal. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Good location”
Reviews.Author: Yukling
Reviews.Content: We arrived at night time, The reception was very friendly and helpful. The staffs are very helpful and can fullfill your simple request speedily. Breakfast was great. I like the fresh fruit and hot dish like scrmble egg and bacon. This hotel was the only hotel that can provide English TV in our trip. There were a lot of channels you can choose. Just one drawback, our room was very very small (not like those we see in website). Just like or may be it's just a single room for double use. We asked the receptionist to reconfirm whether the room was wrongly allocated. She reconfirm that it's correct because of low room rate (around 100 euro), that's the room we can get with this room rate. So be aware of this if you book this hotel with similar rate. Though the room was small, the bed was comfortable and the hotle was very quite. We got good sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: SengaMilne
Reviews.Content: We paid $412.15 Canadian for 2 nights, no breakfast. A continental breakfast was available for 10,00 per person but with many less expensive options close by (Autogrill in Roma Termini) we didn't think the breakfast was worth the cost. The bedding was very nice, loved the diffuser reeds, nice size room and bathroom, Our main complaint was how dirty the towel rack was. We are always willing to reuse towels for conservation purposes but we refused to spread anything over this towel rack and our request to both the housekeeper and the front desk went unheeded. The walls are quite thin which allowed us to hear conversation but not content from the next room. I thought inconsiderate guests slamming doors would be an issue but we were so tired after all the walking we did (transit strike) we could have slept through an earthquake. Our 7 am wake-up call came at 7:15. but fortunately we were awake already. Thin walls, small shower stall, phone in awkward spot in the bathroom and the dirty towel rack were more than compensated for by the great location. While the day front desk staff were very friendly they were not very knowledgeable about anything other than the "major" attractions.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: touristgirl34
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in rome. The receptionist are so nice and happy and they help you as much as they can. the room we had was in third floor with very high ceilings, clean and with all comodities. Many TV chanels, playstation...... breakfast was nice The best, the staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jscarcel
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place to stay in Rome. Close to all of the sites, termini and great restaurants. Staff was very helpful in all areas of customer service from the front desk to the barista and wait staff. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great base and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: derek2008
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a lovely 4 day trip to Rome. As it was our first time there we were unsure were to stay so we decided to stay near Termini Station as our transfer bus from Ciampino dropped us there. As with all major cities and there main train stations we were a bit weary of staying near station but it was a couple of streets away about 5 min walk any nearer looked a bit seedy and noisy! Hotel was around corner from Via Natzionole one of main roads in city centre. There is a McDonalds and lovely Irish bar around corner that served lovely food. Hotel rooms were small and basic but spotless and great base for sight seeing. Staff were very friendly and helpful and gave us great advice on getting around. Would definately go back and reccomend it. great value for money would reccomend Ryanair as airport nearer to city and Terravision Buses run excellent transfer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: janice-g-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 4 nights in this hotel. While our room was quite small, it was adequate and very clean. It was also quiet as it was in the middle of the hotel, facing an inner courtyard - so no views, but also no traffic noise. We found all the staff extremely helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast was adequate with the usual choice of cereals, juices, fruit, bread, cake, eggs and bacon - but they could do with a bigger toaster. The location of the hotel is excellent - 5 minutes walk from Termini, a couple of minutes walk to Republica Metro stop, a 15 minute walk down Nazionale to the Colosseum and easy bus or metro connections to all the other important sites. We used one nice restaurant nearby which was recommended by the hotel - Antica Boheme, I think. But best value for money, with good food, was the area of Trastevere. And its a lovely district with lots of boutiques - very arty. Do go to the large church there, St Maria of Trastevere. Would use Hotel Rex again as it is so convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: reynards
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a three night visit and got a very good deal, 3 nights for the price of two with breakfast included. The staff are very helpful and courteous. The hotel is very clean, beds comfortable and breakfast more than adequate. Our shower was not very efficient but we did not complain. The location is convenient for all the sights and in a relatively quiet street. Found a great little restaurant in the next street towards Termini - unimpressive on the outside but go down some stairs and you will find a gem - filled with Italians and lovely food which as you wait to be seated you can watch being prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Siminco
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Rome to celebrate her 30th Birthday. I was initially a little worried about the hotel because being 5 mins from the central Termini station i expected it to be in a less solubreus district of Rome. However, the hotel was a great location and all the transport links were within 5 mins walk meaning we had fantastic access to anywhere in Rome. The hotel was wonderfully clean, the rooms and beds were very comfortable, the shower was awesome the breakfast more than substantial, there was free internet, a reasonably priced bar, and the staff were INCREDIBLY helpful, polite and friendly. I would not hesitate in booking another trip staying at the hotel Rex and it really went a long way towards making our trip to Rome unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul5485
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Rex for 5 nights during November 2008. The hotel is a 5 to 6 minute walk from the Termini Station and 20 to 30 minutes from the historic city centre and other attractions. The nearest Metro was just 3 to 4 minutes walk from the hotel. The exterior of the hotel doesn't do it justice, the interior is nice and worthy of its stars - though not 'grand' by any means. I think that the interior has been redecorated in part since the photos were published. Our room was nicely decorated, the bed was large (2 singles together) and extremely comfortable, the bathroom (comprising shower cubicle, wash basin, toilet and bidet) was large enough, and all immaculately clean except the bedroom carpet. Upon check-in, we asked for a room with ocean-view which we were given (it was pouring down with rain, massive thunderstorm, and the roads and pavement were like an ocean!!!). Our room wasn't massive but perfectly adequate. We had a widescreen LCD television with its own sky box and fairly good choice of channels. There was also a playstation box but we didn't make use of this as we were out for much of the day. The minibar was well stocked. The room safe was useful. The breakfast was great, two tables of choice from fresh fruit to fresh bread, cooked eggs, bacon and sausages, pastries, cereal, fruit juice etc. The two waitresses were very attentive. All members of staff were extremely polite and courteous, in fact, they pretty much bent over backwards to ensure that we were having a great time in Rome. We were awoken at 6am on the final day by the fire alarm, we duly got dressed and made our way down the stairs only to be told that the delivery of newspapers had set the alarm off - I was half asleep and still don't get the logic there. Whilst the weather was much milder, it was still in the mid 20's and very humid and warm at night. Air conditioning would have done the trick, however, it was turned off, presumably as this is their winter (I'm used to that temperature in mid summer!). We used the hotel internet facility once, just 2 Euros for an hour which I thought was very reasonable. Only downside was the slow connection, waiting and waiting. Probably only really got 20 minutes worth of use during that hour. There is, apparently, a roof top terrace but we couldn't find it. Perhaps it was closed for winter but we didn't ask about it. We ate out at a nearby restaurant recommended by the hotel (it was called something like Giglio Bianca). When we arrived, we observed 2 separate tables arguing with the waiters over the food and they both left without paying for certain parts of the meal. Perhaps this would have been a good time for us to have left, but we went ahead and ordered, and were deeply disappointed with our meals and the terrible service. We ate twice at one restaurant some 3 to 4 minutes away. I have the receipt but I'm not sure which part of it is the name of the restaurant! But it says "S.I. Acquisto Unicum, P.Za Di S.M. Maggiore 164" which looks like an address at least. Ask the hotel to guide you there and you won't be disappointed. The steak was juicy and cooked to absolute perfection. The waiters were chatty, funny and friendly. Given that this hotel was in the centre of the city, the noise (especially that of traffic) was as expected. The windows were double glazed but you wouldn't have guessed that with the level of noise first thing in the morning. Check out was as quick as "thank you, have a nice day!". So other than just the tiniest of niggles (which you'll get everywhere), this hotel was fantastic and if we return to Rome then we would definitely return to Hotel Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thasez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rex for three nights in October. The hotel is in a great location just a five minute walk from the Termini Station and the nearest Metro. We walked to the Colleseum in about 15 mins and you could walk to the other tourist sights if you wanted to. The hotel itself was very nice. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent english and the check in and check out proceedures were quick and without hassle. Our room was cleaned every day and the breakfast was small but nice and they have great free DVD loan for when you want to relax after a long days walking! The only fault was that the door in our room didn't close properly and it was a bit noisy but we didn't complain - i'm sure if we had they would have moved us without a problem. We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at Rex Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyNW
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend in Rome, staying at the Rex. The whole experience was excellent. The hotel is well located, two blocks from Termini train station which is where most people arrive from either of the airports. And it's the right side of the train station, i.e. towards the main sights so you don't have to walk back past the station every day. The street it's on is very quiet so no problem with traffic noise. We walked everywhere for the whole three days, everything from the Vatican to the Colosseum is within half an hour's walk at a decent pace. The room was very comfortable, including air con, a mini bar fridge, a safe and a TV with lots of English speaking channels. Very clean too. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The one thing to watch is breakfast - it may or may not be free depending on how you book. We got a cheaper price by booking on Expedia, but this meant breakfast was not included. And at 15 Euro each, we didn't buy breakfast at the hotel. All in all a very good experience at the Rex!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RomeRex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel end of July, temp 34 degrees, reception and rooms very cool. Booked 2 rooms, double room, bed could have slept four,very large bed, other room was a double, plenty of room. Very good electronic safe in rooms, could change code each time you used it. Best thing of all was staff, very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent, plenty to eat, and wide choice. My teenage children, were very impressed with Rome, and the hotel, played a big part. Would use hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: prowlerchick
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of this hotel on trip advisor before booking through the Airmiles website. I was impressed by most of the reviews especially for a middle of the range budget hotel. It did not dissapoint us. As a young couple my husband and I were impressed with the location (not very far from the Termini main train station - about 10 minutes walk with luggage in the heat) and the local area seemed fine even at night. The hotel staff were very polite and the receptionists were very helpful and friendly. The room was lovely and cool (which was needed as it was 35 degrees most days) and the mini bar had room to put your own drinks in too. The only down side with the room was that we had to rearrange the scart leads to get the PS2 to work and the Sky box and IMac didn't work. Breakfast was your average continental but also included sausages, bacon and scrambled eggs. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinamka
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK for the price. Good location, rooms were not very impressive but not too bad either. I would say its similar to Ramada or Holiday Inn level in USA. The breakfast and service were good. Overall, I would recommend staying there if you are on the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fab 4 family of Five”
Reviews.Author: Family5Perth
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five staying in Rome for a few days and chose this hotel for its location and ability to accommodate our family together in one suite. We had a family suite which consisted of two spacious rooms, one with a king size bed and 2 singles and the other with a double bed. It also had a large bathroom. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff of this hotel were fabulous from our time of booking with Flavia to the very friendly and helpful staff on the front desk, particularly Laura. The breakfasts at the hotel were great and were included in our hotel package.We also loved the location as it was within easy walking distance of many sights, the train station and some great restaurants. We found this hotel perfect for our needs and great value for this price range. We would happily recommend The Rex Hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Ellen3434
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good deal for Rome. I booked easily through the hotel Web site. It's a 10 minute walk from Termini, and the rooms were fairly clean and perfectly acceptable. The breakfast is excellent and the people who work at the front desk are very nice and speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andyjbrook
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Rex based upon the feedback on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. The hotel is in a good location, 5 mins walk from the Termini train station and easy to find, go out of the main train station exit, turn left up via Cavour walk four blocks and then turn right up Via Torino. and walk for another 2 blocks. I thought the location was good, we booked a 2 day Hop on Hop off bus tour ticket and found out that the closet stop from the Rex was about a 3 minute walk, turn left out of the hotel and walk to the Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica, most stops when facing the Basilica are to the right. The Rooms were large enough and of a decent standard, the one drawback for us was that the air conditioning was not robust enough for the room (although my brother who was in a different room said his was working well )and as it was July it was too hot at night but on the plus side the street is very quiet for Rome. The Breakfast was included in our room rate and offered a wide selection of cereals, fruit, bread, cheese and cold meats, juices, coffee, scrambled and hard boiled eggs so enought for most palets, there were alsoplenty of places to eat within a few minutes walk in any direction of the hotel As a closing statement I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff but....”
Reviews.Author: FHtiger
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome so we had very little that we were sure about. We wanted to be close to Termini and we wanted an authentic Roman Hotel. It took about 10 minutes to walk from Termini to the hotel while pulling luggage. Not bad. In fact it was easier than we expected. The map we had seen led us to believe it would be a little further. The staff at the front desk and housekeeping were perfectly friendly and offered us help on a variety of subjects. Being adventurous we tended to venture out on our own and we had a great time just looking around and seeing what we could find. We ate where and when we wanted. We didn't bother with the optional in-hotel breakfast. We preferred to do some sight-seeing on our way. The breakfast looked sufficient but it wasn't very tempting as we walked past. The only real need we had for our room was a place to leave our luggage, clean up upon our return and sleep a few hours before starting again. We never spent more than 8 hours in our room in any given day. The room was clean, but rather dated. Old and authentic was what we wanted, so it was fine. The bathroom was exceptionally clean and well stocked with soap, shampooo, towels, etc. The bed was firm and clean. My biggest complaint was the air conditioner. The light came on and I could hear the fan blowing, but I couldn't feel any air coming out. It got rather warm during the day in the room. In the evening, we opened the window and slept just fine. The street was rather quiet and we could sleep until 6 or 6:30 before the road noise finally got our attention. The lighting was sufficient. The mini-fridge didn't work at all. We would stay again due to the location and the wonderful staff. Bonus: There was a wonderful little market in the street just outside the hotel entrance. We could see it from our room. I would get a cup of coffee and check it out each morning. My only purchase was some wonderful cherries that we snacked on for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rex Great hospitality and service.....”
Reviews.Author: MrsJEngland
Reviews.Content: We (group of three females) stayed at Hotel Rex 16th -20th June. If you want a good location, professional and helpful staff and cleanliness without the expense then this is the place. Location-Hotel Rex is a few minutes walk from the Termini Station in the city. We caught the Leonardo Da Vinci Express from Fiumicino Aiport cost 11 euro's. It takes around 25 minutes to arrive at termini non stop. Once at Termini come out of the station and turn right pass the Mcdonalds(yes there is one here too ) take a left at the big set of traffic lights(onto Via Cavour) the hotel is approx fourth turn on your right (Via Torino) not worth getting a taxi as it is literally a few minutes walk. Almost Everything is within walking distance between 15- 20 minutes taxi's are available only use the white registered ones. They have meters.You have two attractions on your doorstep literally. Santa Maria Magiorre is one end of the road, the other end is the Opera House. Check In- Quick efficient and the reception staff were extremely helpful. Upon check in they provide a free map of the city and point out where you are and where the main attractions are. All hotel information and breakfast times provided. You are provided with a list of restuarants in the immediate area. The reception staff are accomodating nothing seems too much trouble so just ask. They are all helpful and multi lingual (a big mention to Laura thanks for everything you are a star). Check Out-swift no problems Rooms-We were on 1st floor (Lift available) and had a triple room en suite clean, spacious, tv, internet access, fridge,air conditioning which was fab given temperatures were 27-30 degrees everyday. The room was cleaned daily and fresh towels provided daily as required. The maid would come to the room wilst we were out and turn down your sheets and put the bedside lamp on leaving a goodnight card and a sweet(written in italian of course). These are the little touches that make this place special. The decor was a little dated in our room but that didnt matter. Its not going to be to everyone's liking. There is an outside terrace area on the 3rd floor with sun loungers and it is peaceful check it out. Food- We stayed bed and continental breakfast which was fine. Good selection of breads, fresh meats, chees, pastries, hot and cold drinks. Fruits, cereal. Even the fussiest eater would find something. The breakfast area is small but perfectly formed. (see pictures) Tip-Get to breakfast before 9am it tends to get busy later and the choice is limited. There is a lobby area and bar where you can access evening drinks off the menu the hot chocolate is yummy... Public Transport- The options are buses, underground metro, taxi's, tour buses. The metro is cheap, easy to navigate and air conditioned. Cost is 1 euro each way. Tickets can be bought at newstands, tobaccanists or ticket machines at the metro station. The machines operate mulit lingual also. If you take any buses including the trains you must use the yellow machines to validate your ticket before you get on train or bus. Metro is fine as the turnstile machines will stamp it for you. Your ticket has an expiry time of 75 minutes. It can ony be used on metro once but on buses multiple times within the 75 minute period. Tour Buses-There are many tour buses taking you to different attractions. We used the green "tour rome bus" 17 euro's for 24 hour ticket and takes you to all the main attractions. Its hop on hop off which is great you can get on and off as many times as you like within the 24 hours period. 24 hour period starts from the time you buy the ticket. The tickets/tour buses are available from termini station. I could go on forever but I wont. We will be returning to the Hotel Rex which I believe speaks volumes. It isworthy of its stars. One last tip -the return trip to the airport we used the hotel's private car/minubus 50 euro's which is good if there is a group of you airconditioned to and a chance to have one last look at the sights en route. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kazza78
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on other reviews on Trip advisor. I was quite surprised when we checked in. We got a really small room that needed re-decorated. The bed was quite small too - definitely not a normal double. They may have not given us the best room as we were only there for one night. There was only ever one person on reception which meant it took a long time to check in and out. I have stayed in better places in Rome for less money in the same general location

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: gsugrad
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and knowledgeble. My luggage was lost and they offered to call luggage information number to find out it's wherebouts. Thankfully, it was found and delivered to the hotel the next day. The room is definitely not 4 star. It's tiny, which I was fine with since I wasn't in Rome to stay in the room. It was also very outdated and in bad need of renovation. Be advised, you might have to take your luggage up or down stairs after getting off the elevator. This is due to building being very old. I think location is one of the best in Rome. It's within walking distance of most Rome sights. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: GermanyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rex for a week to explore the sights of Rome. For this the hotel is fairly well situated; many places are within easy walking distance and for others there is a major subway station right around the corner. The hotel itself is OK with decent staff, but really nothing special. Prepare to have to wait for lengthy periods of time when they are (or claim to be) busy. Rooms are very small and dark, but reasonably well kept and clean. Breakfast has a somewhat limited selection but is OK, too, except for the room it is served in which tends to be far too small for the number of guests. Overall the Rex offers reasonable value for money; it is, after all, in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: bcrollie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rex for three nights. The service from the front desk was outstanding - they were able to answer all of our questions and provide directions, etc. Actually, every staff member we encountered provided excellent service. There was a lot of variety in their free breakfast (cold cuts, cheeses, croissants, etc.) and they even had a couple of hot dishes, too. The room we stayed in was dated. The room was clean, but didn't feel clean as the carpet and bed coverings looked worn, and we had an ant trap in our bathroom. But overall, it was good value. We were only in Rome for a few days and there was so much to see and do, that we hardly spent any time in our room. The Rex is located near a couple of metro stations, and within a 10-12 minute walk to the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for great service!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinetraveller22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rex in Rome for three nights with our baby daughter (3 months old). We got a big room with a babycot. Service was good and the staff very helpful and service-minded. Good value as the hotel i situated in the central of Rome (we walked everywhere!), close to the station as well. We would recommend it to our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if traveling by train”
Reviews.Author: newtonmatraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel if you arriving or departing by train to Rome. It's only 2 blocks to station. The rooms are modern and clean (need some minor updates), One interesting thing is that have Imacs in the room as well as Sony Playstations which our son loved. The free breakfast was above average. If you are traveling around Italy take the trains don't fly. It took us longer to get Milan by flying than by train when you factor in security, check in etc. If you do fly there is an express train to the airport that leaves once per hour. And if you fly Alitlia to Malpensa in Milan, there is a whole separate check in line. We stood in the one for domestic flights for and hour only to find out it was domestic EXCEPT for Malpensa.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rex has great customer service”
Reviews.Author: skyviking
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rex is a small hotel near the Opera House in Rome. The hotel's Staff are excellent. They are very helpful with directions and information in the city. They also show you how to get around the metro system the fastest way to the sights. They have a nice breakfast in the morning which is included. If you want something special it will cost you a little more. For example, if you want your eggs done a different way. The only complaint I have about this hotel is the air conditioning system. It seemed to go out every evening. We would wake up in the middle of the night hot. I asked the staff about it and they just said it was being fixed? Nice comfortable rooms on the small side like most of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: gdavan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in April while travelling in Italy. The hotel was located near the train station which was important to us since we were flying out the next day. We've been to Rome several times and have stayed in several hotel. Hotel Rex was a nice place. The room was nice and the staff was very friendly and recommended a great restaraunt near by. This is a great option and is walking distance to a lot of the great attractions Rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jack_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 29 Dec to 01 Jan 08 and I would certainly recommend this hotel. It was about a 10 minute walk max from the train station and we did this easily with our suitcases. The staff were English speaking and very helpful and helped us with directions to certain places and gave advice on the best places to go for New Year. The complimentary champagne and chocolates on New Years eve was a great touch! The breakfast was varied and good and our room was more than adequate, we were at the front of the hotel with a view of a small street. The location is great, about 20 minutes walk to the Colesseum and although it is walkable to the Vatican (about 40 minutes walk) you can easily get on the tube and save your legs. There were very long queues for both the Colesseum and the Vatican, although at both places we paid to have a guided tour and that meant you could go pretty much to the front of the queue. My only word of caution would be to keep your eyes open when crossing the roads - they don't seem to want to stop even when your on a pedestrian crossing. The staff were very welcoming and friendly and if traditon follows that we will return to Rome (having thrown a coin into the Trevi Fountain) then I would definetly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: toga33
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay a Hotel Rex, particularly the Location exceptional with access to main train station and even close was Republica Subway station. Hotel Staff was great and very responsive. Breakfast included was also sufficient. Like previous post we did find some ants in our bathroom also, but if you consider how old this buildings are I can understand. Soon as we notified the staff it was all taken care off.

Reviews.Title: “Booking problems...”
Reviews.Author: Annalise_Andy_UK
Reviews.Content: Travellers beware - we booked our stay over the internet via the hotel's own website. We never received a confirmation email. A deposit was not taken from my credit card. The lack of a confirmation prompted me to phone them 2 days before we left to make sure our booking had been received - it hadn't! The people at the front desk spoke poor English apart from one person who had lived in Australia. One person told me that we did have a reservation, another person that we didn't! The uncertaintly hardly filled me with confidence... we eventually chose to stay at the Radisson SAS! This looks like a great hotel and good value for money but DON'T BOOK VIA THEIR INTERNET SITE! Book with confidence via one of the big sites like Expedia - at least you know your room is secure.

Reviews.Title: “best city hotel i've been”
Reviews.Author: SLiM82
Reviews.Content: really, really friendly staff! clean rooms... and the best of all: the breakfast! we read in the internet that the italians don't care much about breakfast - but in the rex it was perfect! you can really feel the the rex-staff cares about their guests and for the price we paid there is no other rating than "excellent". the only thing to complain about would be the room's view out of the window (= non-pretty grey inner-courtyard) but let's be honest: who cares? :)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the location of Hotel Rex. Most sights within a 1 mile walk.”
Reviews.Author: jotim
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location of Hotel Rex. Most sights are within 1 mile of the hotel. We walked all over Rome. Prefered that than public transportation. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms seemed to be recently remodeled. No great views from the two different rooms we stayed in before and after our cruise but I think that can be expected in the heart of Rome. Free breakfast each morning which included scrambled eggs, bacon, breads, croissants, pastries, cereal, fruit, yogurt and cheese. We booked through Venere.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & central.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew'n'Helen
Reviews.Content: Reasonalbe standard of hotel in a central area - just a few minutes walk from Rome Termino train station (we did the walk with suitcases easily). Hotel is well decorated with the exception of some carpet stains - however the hotel is clean. The hotel is airconditioned, although in July when the temperature is high 30's it struggled to keep the room cool - could do with upgrading. HOWEVER for the low price and the central location the hotel is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: Anon47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rex from 5th to 8th of June. The hotel was an easy walk from Termini with a trolley case and backpack each. The staff were friendly and helpful - asking if it was our first visit to Rome we were provided with a map and given advice on bus and metro routes. They also suggested a restaurant for our first night (we arrived at 10:30pm) v close to the hotel. We had a large room on the 3rd floor. As well as the main bedroom we had a dressing room with i-mac PC and large bathroom. We overlooked a small street to the front of the hotel but we were too high up to see much. The roof terrace was an added advantage and after a long day at the Vatican it was lovely to sit and soak up the late afternoon sunshine in peace and quiet. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Rex again, we travelled back up to Rome from Sorrento and unfortunately had booked the Borromini for out last night, how I wished I could have been back at the Rex. We enjoy walking and walked to / from all sights from the hotel with no problems but there are metro / bus stops nearby. The feet did hurt a bit by the end of day 3 but then you're in Rome, what do you expect! Perfect base for a sightseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Austin_Meadows
Reviews.Content: Location We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Rex, which made a good base for sight-seeing, as part of a mini-break at the end of May. We travelled with easyJet from East Mids, UK to Rome Ciampino airport. The airport provides a bus service (Terravision) into Termini rail-station in the centre of Rome. Tickets are available in the arrivals part of the airport or you can book on-line. Via Torino , where Hotel Rex is located, is a 5 - 10 minute walk from the rail station with luggage. There are a small number of restaurants in the surrounding streets. Rooms We stayed in a room with a double bed. Our room was quite small, but was comfortable and clean. The room also included a free safe. There were no tea making facilities, but my other half used her travel kettle. The bathroom was of a high standard too. The room was very quiet and we had no major disturbances. The room also included a TV. Service When we checked into the hotel, the staff were very friendly. On collecting the key, they give us a map of Rome and the receptionist drew a route on the map the sights and which order to visit them in. We followed these directions, on the map, and saw some good sights. Dinning The hotel did not provide an evening meal service, but each morning a breakfast was available in the bar area. This consisted of cereals, croissants, sausages, scrambled eggs, yogurts, tea/coffee and fruit juices. Evening meals were available in the restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A brill place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EmmaDave
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely 4* hotel, staff are extremely helpful and friendly, the hotel is very well located close to all the arractions. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone, it was excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “we didn't even stay!”
Reviews.Author: ThessalonikiIoanna
Reviews.Content: After we contacted the hotel directly by phone (we even told an italian speaking friend of us to make the call so that we wouldn't have any problems of communication) the receptionist told us there was an availability. We agreed on the price and the receptionist gave us instructions to book the room via email. We immediately sent an email with our personal data icluding the credit card number and made the reservation. Silly of us to think that we had booked a room!!! Luckily we phoned the hotel two days later to confirm our reservation only to find an arrogant italian at the other end of the line telling us that there was no reservation and no available rooms for a month. Be careful of the way you book , you might find yourselves on the street!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Stay at Hotel Rex”
Reviews.Author: MadAboutBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in Rome (just happened to be over Easter). We selected the hotel due to the location (within walking distance of train station). The hotel rooms are very dark (most overlook interior service alley). The soft goods (curtains, carpet, bedspread) need a thorough washing, but thankfully the bathrooms and sheets were clean. The breakfasts were very good - would have been nice to be able to order eggs a la carte instead of buffet-style. The staff at the Front Desk and in breakfast room were very friendly. If I were to return, I would stay closer to the Pantheon (a lot more convenient to historic sights).

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: DivingD
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a four night stay in the Hotel rex in Rome. The hotel is well situated within walking distance (with luggage) to Termini station.The staff were very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The room was large and clean even if the view was not that interesting. There are also plenty of good restaurants nearby and the staff will give you good.I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: hk1303
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Hotel Rex. On arrival we hopped straight on a train from the airport to Terminal and easily found the hotel 5 mins walk from the station. Not too bad with a wheeled suitcase. Recieved a warm welcome at reception and were given a large room with plenty of storage space, tv, minibar etc. and a huge bed. Bathroom was decent size and clean with a powerful walk in shower and I liked the extra touches with some soap, showergel, hand moisteriser, make up remover etc. Location was good. About 10 mins to Trevi Fountain, 15 Coluseem, 5 to Termini station. We walked absolutely everywhere but it would have been extremely convenient for the metro if you were so inclined. Breakfast was until 10:30 but I think if you got in there towards the end of service then there was a distinct lack of bread. One day there was cold toast left! However there were also cereals, cheese, ham, yoghurts, fresh fruit and fruits in their juices, scrambled egg and bacon or frankfurtas. It wasn't a bad breakfast but it also was not one of the best. We would defintely stay here again and I would say if you are able to secure a good price, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall experience”
Reviews.Author: smackmeister
Reviews.Content: We intially booked Hotel Rex because of the location, 4 star rating and the fact they had internet access. We changed hotels mid stream during our Roman holiday simply because the other hotel did not have internet. We were very pleased with the results. The location was not quite as good as our previous accomodations but it was still in the thick of things. About 15 minute walk to Trevi fountain or the Coliseum. The room was large with a nice view. The free breakfast was also decent. The hotel might not be a true 4 star hotel but we were pleased overall. I would recommend it! One thing to note, the internet was a hassle. If you have your own computer, you have to hard code the IP address. If you don't know what that is, you might be in for a tech lesson to get online. I think some of the rooms did have a computer already, and might be easier to use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MaryCork
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Rome before, in a three star the first time and a 5 star the second time, we knew not to expect too much from a star rating. So, booking the 4 Star Hotel Rex, we didnt expect a great deal. What we found though, was a very friendly and helpful staff, clean large rooms (although decor a bit dated), good breakfast by Rome standards, and a superb location, literally around the corner from Termini station, where we could get the train to and from the Fiumicini Airport, and metro to anywhere in the city, along with bus services if you wanted to venture outside of the city. We could walk to everywhere in city, even to the Colisseum, although a bit far if the weather was hot. The bus services around the city are frequent and crowded. You have to buy tickets from a newsagent before you can get on the buses, where there is a machine on board to validate them. The bus services 40 and 64 are around the corner from the hotel and go to all the major attractions. Dont expect too much from food in italy - tasteless and not nicely cooked, and we've eaten food from roadside carts to low, medium and high priced restaurants and hotels over our three visits to the city. There was absolutely NO nice dish anywhere! During this visit, we resorted to a chinese to try to get something decent - it was only average and we had to ask for the food to be reheated. And, dont expect to see ANY clean toilets outside your hotel. (apart from the Vatican) And I dont mean just dirty, I mean DISGUSTING. We've travelled the world and have NEVER EVER seen anything so bad. The worst was a MacDonalds near Spanish Steps. But, one goes to Rome to see the sights and they certainly do not disappoint. 3 or 4 days is enough in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carol962
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rex pre-cruise on November 8, 2006. We found the staff exceptional and very accomodating to "American tourists." The breakfast was lovely and substantial. The room we had was large and very comfortable and we had a lovely overnight stay. The location was great as it was only a couple of blocks from the Metro and the train station. Staying at this hotel was a nice surprise and if we visit Rome again we would definately consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ok hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: fh1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Rex for 5 nights, and overall the experience was ok. Our room was very small. We had three people, so we had the "triple" room with 3 smaller than avg twin size beds, but from judging from all our research before we booked this room, most of the hotels in rome looked like they had relatively small rooms. Also, the bathroom was huge, but the bathtub was tiny and high so if you are tall you would hit the mildew infested celing. The showerhead was detachable but not really usable as a real shower because if you hung it up on the stand, then it would shoot straight across the bathtub and get the bathroom floor all wet, you would still be dry in the bathtub. Overall the bathroom was clean besides the ceiling of course, and the sheets were always crisp and clean, which was good and the there was plenty of hot water. we did not use the ac since it was pretty cool when we went. The rooms are probably a little outdated, but if you just need a clean place to stay this place works. Its in an excellent location, near the main train station so you never have to go far to get a bus or train. Also, I read in another review of this hotel that you have to leave the keys with the front desk. YES, you "have" to leave the keys which is kind of weird, that is what we were told when we took them with us one day. and also, there is only one entrance to the hotel so they know everytime you go in and out, which is kinda weird. You can always use the safe in the room for valuables. Also, apparently Italy has several different types of plugs, so you have to have a shape changer which the front desk was out of. The breakfast was ok, they had the basic things. Overall the hotel was pretty good, def. not "four star" quality but clean with a good location. Also, the TV was ok, we didn't really get any channels in english so we were basiclly out of touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: judywes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Rex for five nights in October 2006. The air conditioning was not working, so they put a stand-alone fan in my room, which helped. My room (201), a single, was very small, but clean, compact, and comfortable with crisp white sheets every day, and an excellent breakfast. It has a roof top terrace, which is a nice place to cool off in the evenings. Friends in a double room said they had mold in the shower and their room was hot, even with a portable fan. The location of The Rex, on Via Torino, is excellent: within walking distance of the train station, Metro, good restaurants, opera house, Colosseum and adequate shopping. A block away is a particularly lovely bar/market (Enoteca Goffredo Chirra). It has great light meals, good selection of wines, exceptional hot chocolate, and a friendly helpful staff. My only complaint about the staff at The Rex was in making arrangements for transportation to the airport at 4:00 a.m. I had to remind them twice, once after ten p.m. and while I had requested a taxi for 45 Euros, they ordered at private car for 60 euros, and I was not notified until the car arrived with no time to find another ride. A note of caution re taxi/car prices. If you travel after midnight, an additional charge of five euros is added. Other than that, as a single woman traveling mostly alone, I felt safe and comfortble at The Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Rome”
Reviews.Author: luke9
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 3 nights and hardly got a sleep. The aircon did not function and when I complained I got told all the rooms were the same. I persisted and requested a change of room. The other room also had the cool function disabled on the aircon. This was in a rainy September weekend, it must be hell in summer. The bed in the first room was a slab of soft foam rubber, the second room was exactly the same. The worst beds I have ever slept on.

Reviews.Title: “Average and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mark23
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location which is fairly central. Although 4 star, the level of luxury in the hotel falls well short of such standard. Both the exterior and internal furnishings of the hotel are unimpressive. The rooms nevertheless are very spacious. I found the staff not particularly friendly. When arriving down to breakfast on the dot of 10.30, when the breakfast was to finish, the staff created an unnecessary fuss. They spoke across in Italian and judging by their tone, it was giving out. This was quite embarrassing. The hotel also has the extremely old fashioned and intrusive policy of requiring guests to leave the key in at reception when going out. This was not an option -we were told we had too so. Overall I would expect more for the price and better treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and clean place”
Reviews.Author: LisheVillage
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time, nice staff, clean room and great breakfast. Thanks!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Rex
HotelInfo.Address: Via Torino 149, 00184 Rome, Italy
